MATH 233C.description: Basic commutative algebra and classical algebraic geometry. Algebraic varieties, morphisms, rational maps, blow ups. Theory of schemes, sheaves, divisors, cohomology. Algebraic curves and surfaces, Riemann-Roch theorem, Jacobians,  classification of curves and surfaces.

MATH 234A.name: Topics in Algebra
MATH 234A.description: Group theory, homological algebra, and other selected topics.

MATH 234B.name: Topics in Algebra
MATH 234B.description: Group theory, homological algebra, and other selected topics.

MATH 234C.name: Topics in Algebra
MATH 234C.description: Group theory, homological algebra, and other selected topics.

MATH 235A.name: Mathematics of Cryptography
MATH 235A.description: Mathematics of public key cryptography: encryption and signature schemes

MATH 239A.name: Analytic Methods in Arithmetic Geometry
MATH 239A.description: Riemann zeta function, Dirichlet L-functions, prime number theorem, zeta functions over finite fields, sieve methods, zeta functions of algebraic curves, algebraic coding theory, L-Functions over number fields, L-functions of modular forms, Eisenstein series.

MATH 239B.name: Analytic Methods in Arithmetic Geometry
MATH 239B.description: Riemann zeta function, Dirichlet L-functions, prime number theorem, zeta functions over finite fields, sieve methods, zeta functions of algebraic curves, algebraic coding theory, L-Functions over number fields, L-functions of modular forms, Eisenstein series.

MATH 239C.name: Analytic Methods in Arithmetic Geometry
MATH 239C.description: Riemann zeta function, Dirichlet L-functions, prime number theorem, zeta functions over finite fields, sieve methods, zeta functions of algebraic curves, algebraic coding theory, L-Functions over number fields, L-functions of modular forms, Eisenstein series.

MATH 240A.name: Differential Geometry
MATH 240A.description: Riemannian manifolds, connections, curvature, and torsion. Submanifolds, mean curvature, Gauss curvature equation. Geodesics, minimal submanifolds, first and second fundamental forms, variational formulas. Comparison theorems and their geometric applications. Hodge theory applications to geometry and topology.

MATH 240B.name: Differential Geometry
MATH 240B.description: Riemannian manifolds, connections, curvature and torsion. Submanifolds, mean curvature, Gauss curvature equation. Geodesics, minimal submanifolds, first and second fundamental forms, variational formulas. Comparison theorems and their geometric applications. Hodge theory applications to geometry and topology.

MATH 240C.name: Differential Geometry
MATH 240C.description: Riemannian manifolds, connections, curvature and torsion. Submanifolds, mean curvature, Gauss curvature equation. Geodesics, minimal submanifolds, first and second fundamental forms, variational formulas. Comparison theorems and their geometric applications. Hodge theory applications to geometry and topology.

MATH 245A.name: Topics in Geometric Analysis
MATH 245A.description: Studies in selected areas of differential geometry, a continuation of MATH 240A-MATH 240B-MATH 240C. Topics addressed vary each quarter.

MATH 245B.name: Topics in Geometric Analysis
MATH 245B.description: Studies in selected areas of differential geometry, a continuation of MATH 240A-MATH 240B-MATH 240C. Topics addressed vary each quarter.

MATH 245C.name: Topics in Geometric Analysis
MATH 245C.description: Studies in selected areas of differential geometry, a continuation of MATH 240A-MATH 240B-MATH 240C. Topics addressed vary each quarter.

MATH 249.name: Topics in Differential Geometry
MATH 249.description: Studies in selected areas of differential geometry. Topics addressed vary each quarter.

MATH 250A.name: Algebraic Topology
MATH 250A.description: Provides fundamental materials in algebraic topology: fundamental group and covering space, homology and cohomology theory, and homotopy group.
MATH 250A.prereqString: Prerequisite: Recommended: MATH 120B and MATH 141, or equivalent.

MATH 250B.name: Algebraic Topology
MATH 250B.description: Provides fundamental materials in algebraic topology: fundamental group and covering space, homology and cohomology theory, and homotopy group.

MATH 250C.name: Algebraic Topology
MATH 250C.description: Provides fundamental materials in algebraic topology: fundamental group and covering space, homology and cohomology theory, and homotopy group.

MATH 260A.name: Functional Analysis
MATH 260A.description: Normed linear spaces, Hilbert spaces, Banach spaces, Stone-Weierstrass Theorem, locally convex spaces, bounded operators on Banach and Hilbert spaces, the Gelfand-Neumark Theorem for commutative C*-algebras, the spectral theorem for bounded self-adjoint operators, unbounded operators on Hilbert spaces.

MATH 260B.name: Functional Analysis
MATH 260B.description: Normed linear spaces, Hilbert spaces, Banach spaces, Stone-Weierstrass Theorem, locally convex spaces, bounded operators on Banach and Hilbert spaces, the Gelfand-Neumark Theorem for commutative C*-algebras, the spectral theorem for bounded self-adjoint operators, unbounded operators on Hilbert spaces.

MATH 260C.name: Functional Analysis
MATH 260C.description: Normed linear spaces, Hilbert spaces, Banach spaces, Stone-Weierstrass Theorem, locally convex spaces, bounded operators on Banach and Hilbert spaces, the Gelfand-Neumark Theorem for commutative C*-algebras, the spectral theorem for bounded self-adjoint operators, unbounded operators on Hilbert spaces.

MATH 270A.name: Probability
MATH 270A.description: Probability spaces, distribution, and characteristic functions. Strong limit theorems. Limit distributions for sums of independent random variables. Conditional expectation and martingale theory. Stochastic processes.
MATH 270A.prereqString: Prerequisite: MATH 210C. Recommended: MATH 130C or equivalent.

MATH 270B.name: Probability
MATH 270B.description: Probability spaces, distribution and characteristic functions. Strong limit theorems. Limit distributions for sums of independent random variables. Conditional expectation and martingale theory. Stochastic processes.

MATH 270C.name: Probability
MATH 270C.description: Probability spaces, distribution and characteristic functions. Strong limit theorems. Limit distributions for sums of independent random variables. Conditional expectation and martingale theory. Stochastic processes.

MATH 271A.name: Stochastic Processes
MATH 271A.description: Processes with independent increments, Wiener and Gaussian processes, function space integrals, stationary processes, Markov processes.

MATH 271B.name: Stochastic Processes
MATH 271B.description: Processes with independent increments, Wiener and Gaussian processes, function space integrals, stationary processes, Markov processes.

MATH 271C.name: Stochastic Processes
MATH 271C.description: Processes with independent increments, Wiener and Gaussian processes, function space integrals, stationary processes, Markov processes.

MATH 274.name: Topics in Probability
MATH 274.description: Selected topics, such as theory of stochastic processes, martingale theory, stochastic integrals, stochastic differential equations.

MATH 281A.name: Set Theory
MATH 281A.description: Ordinals, cardinals, cardinal arithmetic, combinatorial set theory, models of set theory, Gödel's constructible universe, forcing, large cardinals, iterate forcing, inner model theory, fine structure.

MATH 281B.name: Set Theory
MATH 281B.description: Ordinals, cardinals, cardinal arithmetic, combinatorial set theory, models of set theory, Gödel's constructible universe, forcing, large cardinals, iterate forcing, inner model theory, fine structure.

MATH 281C.name: Set Theory
MATH 281C.description: Ordinals, cardinals, cardinal arithmetic, combinatorial set theory, models of set theory, Gödel's constructible universe, forcing, large cardinals, iterate forcing, inner model theory, fine structure.

MATH 282A.name: Model Theory
MATH 282A.description: Languages, structures, compactness, and completeness. Model-theoretic constructions. Omitting types theorems. Morley's theorem. Ranks, forking. Model completeness. O-minimality. Applications to algebra.

MATH 282B.name: Model Theory
MATH 282B.description: Languages, structures, compactness and completeness. Model-theoretic constructions. Omitting types theorems. Morley's theorem. Ranks, forking. Model completeness. O-minimality. Applications to algebra.

MATH 282C.name: Model Theory
MATH 282C.description: Languages, structures, compactness and completeness. Model-theoretic constructions. Omitting types theorems. Morley's theorem. Ranks, forking. Model completeness. O-minimality. Applications to algebra.

MATH 285.name: Topics in Mathematical Logic
MATH 285.description: Studies in selected areas of mathematical logic, a continuation of MATH 280A-MATH 280B-MATH 280C. Topics addressed vary each quarter.

MATH 290A.name: Methods in Applied Mathematics
MATH 290A.description: Introduction to ODEs and dynamical systems: existence and uniqueness. Equilibria and periodic solutions. Bifurcation theory. Perturbation methods: approximate solution of differential equations. Multiple scales and WKB. Matched asymptotic. Calculus of variations: direct methods, Euler-Lagrange equation. Second variation and Legendre condition.

MATH 290B.name: Methods in Applied Mathematics
MATH 290B.description: Introduction to ODEs and dynamical systems: existence and uniqueness. Equilibria and periodic solutions. Bifurcation theory. Perturbation methods: approximate solution of differential equations. Multiple scales and WKB. Matched asymptotic. Calculus of variations: direct methods, Euler-Lagrange equation. Second variation and Legendre condition.

MATH 290C.name: Methods in Applied Mathematics
MATH 290C.description: Introduction to ODEs and dynamical systems: existence and uniqueness. Equilibria and periodic solutions. Bifurcation theory. Perturbation methods: approximate solution of differential equations. Multiple scales and WKB. Matched asymptotic. Calculus of variations: direct methods, Euler-Lagrange equation. Second variation and Legendre condition.

MATH 295A.name: Partial Differential Equations
MATH 295A.description: Theory and techniques for linear and nonlinear partial differential equations. Local and global theory of partial differential equations: analytic, geometric, and functional analytic methods.
MATH 295A.prereqString: Prerequisite: MATH 210C. Recommended: MATH 112B and MATH 112C or equivalent.

MATH 295B.name: Partial Differential Equations
MATH 295B.description: Theory and techniques for linear and nonlinear partial differential equations. Local and global theory of partial differential equations: analytic, geometric, and functional analytic methods.

MATH 295C.name: Partial Differential Equations
MATH 295C.description: Theory and techniques for linear and nonlinear partial differential equations. Local and global theory of partial differential equations: analytic, geometric, and functional analytic methods.

MATH 296.name: Topics in Partial Differential Equations
MATH 296.description: Studies in selected areas of partial differential equations, a continuation of MATH 295A-MATH 295B-MATH 295C. Topics addressed vary each quarter.

MATH 297.name: Mathematics Colloquium
MATH 297.description: Weekly colloquia on topics of current interest in mathematics.

MATH 298A.name: Seminar
MATH 298A.description: Seminars organized for detailed discussion of research problems of current interest in the Department. The format, content, frequency, and course value are variable.

MATH 298B.name: Seminar
MATH 298B.description: Seminars organized for detailed discussion of research problems of current interest in the Department. The format, content, frequency, and course value are variable.

MATH 298C.name: Seminar
MATH 298C.description: Seminars organized for detailed discussion of research problems of current interest in the Department. The format, content, frequency, and course value are variable.

MATH 299A.name: Supervised Reading and Research
MATH 299A.description: Supervised reading and research with Mathematics faculty.

MATH 299B.name: Supervised Reading and Research
MATH 299B.description: Supervised reading and research with Mathematics faculty.

MATH 299C.name: Supervised Reading and Research
MATH 299C.description: Supervised reading and research with Mathematics faculty.

MED HUM 1.name: Health, Wellness, and Conception of the Body
MED HUM 1.description: Asks what is health and who gets to have it? What is considered a “healthy” or “sick” body? We analyze historical and contemporary experiences of illness, medicine, and caregiving, including how patients represent their bodies and healing.

MED HUM 3.name: Art and Medicine
MED HUM 3.description: Analyzes the relationship between medicine and the visual arts from the late medieval to modern periods, covering topics such as anatomy, optical medical technologies, gender and race in medicine, and popular representations of disease and doctors.

MED HUM 137.name: Surviving Epidemics
MED HUM 137.description: Analyzes diverse social and cultural responses to epidemics from mid-nineteenth century to the present, including incarceration, caregiving, and disability rights. Using interdisciplinary materials and collaborative activities, students interpret strategies and outcomes of Indigenous, racialized, and marginalized communities surviving great illness.
MED HUM 137.prereqString: Prerequisite: Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.
MED HUM 137.restriction: Restriction: Upper-division students only. Sophomores only.

MED HUM 195.name: Capstone Seminar: The Clinical Moral Laboratory
MED HUM 195.description: Interdisciplinary exploration of the clinical encounter, and the importance of meaning making in these “moral laboratories.” Students enter the clinical space as participant observers, and reflect on how the clinical site informs and challenges reading practices.
MED HUM 195.prereqString: Prerequisite: MED HUM 1 or MED HUM 3 or GEN&SEX 60A. Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.

MED HUM 200.name: Critical Perspectives in Medical Humanities
MED HUM 200.description: Analyzes social and cultural understandings of the body, health, illness, medicine, and disease. Themes include critical histories of the body

MGMT 1.name: Introduction to Business and Management
MGMT 1.description: Rigorous overview of major business functions and management topics. Addresses the global and fast-changing environment in which modern business enterprises operate as well as the challenges posed by concerns about sustainable growth, ethics, and social responsibility.
MGMT 1.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 4A.name: Basic Economics for Managers I
MGMT 4A.description: Microeconomic principles for managers. Useful applications of basic economic principles to situations in business as well as in various professions. Materials fee.
MGMT 4A.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment. For School of Social Sciences majors, MGMT 4A may not be used as a substitute for ECON 20A.

MGMT 4B.name: Basic Economics for Managers II
MGMT 4B.description: Macroeconomic principles for managers. Useful applications of basic economic principles to situations in business as well as in various professions.
MGMT 4B.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment. For School of Social Sciences majors, MGMT 4B may not be used as a substitute for ECON 20B.

MGMT 5.name: Management of Contemporary Organizations
MGMT 5.description: Equips students with working knowledge of several major subject areas within the context of business and society studies. Topics include:  role of management in organizations, corporate social responsibility and responsiveness, ethics and values in business, government regulation, and international business.

MGMT 7.name: Statistics for Business Decision Making
MGMT 7.description: Basics of data analysis and the fundamental notion of statistical inference emphasizing applications to administrative and management decision problems. Classical estimation and hypotheses testing, regression, correlation, analysis of variance, nonparametric methods, and statistical probability.
MGMT 7.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 30A.name: Principles of Accounting I
MGMT 30A.description: First in a two course introductory series. Emphasis on financial accounting concepts and practices essential to the administration of business enterprises
MGMT 30A.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 30B.name: Principles of Accounting II
MGMT 30B.description: Second in a two-course introductory series. Emphasis is on the introduction of managerial accounting concepts and techniques as tools to aid management in carrying out the primary internal functions of planning, control, and decision-making.
MGMT 30B.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 90.name: Special Topics in Management
MGMT 90.description: Studies in selected areas of management. Topics addressed vary each quarter.

MGMT 101.name: Management Science
MGMT 101.description: Concepts and methods of management science, which applies mathematical modeling and analysis to management problems. Topics include linear and integer programming, project scheduling, inventory management, queuing analysis, decision analysis, and simulation.
MGMT 101.restriction: Restriction: Upper-division students only. Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 102.name: Managing Organizational Behavior
MGMT 102.description: Basic theory and concepts which provide the manager with tools for understanding behavior of people in organizations. Areas such as individual, group, and organizational determinants of attitudes, turnover, and job performance.
MGMT 102.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 105.name: Introduction to Marketing
MGMT 105.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 107.name: Introduction to Management Information Systems
MGMT 107.description: Information Technology (IT) continues to drive rapid productivity growth and structural changes in the economy. Topics include what IT is, and how companies can use IT to improve business processes, enhance customer services, and gain competitive advantage over rivals.
MGMT 107.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 109.name: Introduction to Managerial Finance
MGMT 109.description: Basics of financial administration. Capital budgeting, cost of capital, cash budgeting, working capital management, and long-term sources of funds. Provides a basic understanding of issues and techniques involved in financial decision making.
MGMT 109.restriction: Restriction: Upper-division students only. Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 110.name: Strategic Management
MGMT 110.description: Addresses management of the entire business.  Role of the general manager in organizations, industry analysis, core competencies, growth through vertical integration, innovation, acquisition and diversification, globalization, strategy implementation, and the ethical and moral responsibility of a manager.
MGMT 110.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT 102 and MGMT 105 and MGMT 109
MGMT 110.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 111.name: China and the Global Order
MGMT 111.description: Introduces students to China's economic and military relations with the world, assessment of likelihood for conflict, and how to strategically manage business risk from regional conflict. Includes an original documentary series and engaging discussion.

MGMT 113.name: New Ventures: A Course in Entrepreneurship
MGMT 113.description: Introduction to the survival and growth of new ventures. Methods include analysis of live cases, guest speakers, discussion, and field projects with contemporary new ventures to learn about new venture management and surviving the liabilities of newness.
MGMT 113.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 115.name: Lean Startup
MGMT 115.description: Based on the well-known Lean Launchpad course currently used by a growing segment of the startup world. Students work in teams to ideate, develop a Business Model Canvas, and gather customer/market feedback.
MGMT 115.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 120.name: Managing Organizational Change
MGMT 120.description: Focuses on the implementation of change. Identifies the features of successful changes in organizations of varying sizes and configurations, with an emphasis on the reasons why individuals resist or embrace change.

MGMT 123.name: Creativity and Leadership in Entrepreneurial Organizations
MGMT 123.description: Learn about your own thinking process
MGMT 123.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 124.name: Human Resources Management
MGMT 124.description: Theory and practice of managing human resources. Students will identify and analyze HR dilemmas, apply labor law, and design systems and processes to develop the human resources needed to help organizations achieve their goals.
MGMT 124.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Business Information Mgmt Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 125.name: Negotiations
MGMT 125.description: The objective is to assist students in developing an understanding of different theoretical perspectives and develop their skills in negotiating. Exploration of feelings and beliefs about negotiation, negotiation skills, and putting theory into action by practicing new negotiation skills.
MGMT 125.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 126.name: Foundations of Teams
MGMT 126.description: Social and psychological processes that detract from effective teamwork and collaboration. Tools to understand how to be a better team member are introduced. Provides the foundation for students to become effective team leaders and to manage difficult team situations.
MGMT 126.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 127.name: Business Ethics
MGMT 127.description: Comprehensive introduction to ethical considerations in business with a focus on awareness to the complexity of ethical decision-making and how to make choices from a standpoint of ethical consciousness.
MGMT 127.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 128.name: International Management
MGMT 128.description: Impact of different cultures and political/economic systems on assumptions, expectations, and organizational practices relevant to conducting business in different national settings. Understanding of the challenges of cross-national management and resources utilized to work and conduct business outside the United States.
MGMT 128.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 129.name: Leadership
MGMT 129.description: Case analyses, free-form discussion, and written assignments designed to develop critical thinking skills, as well as knowledge of approaches to differing leadership challenges. Experiential exercises encourage students to develop their ability to innovate, foster collaboration, manage conflict, and value diversity.
MGMT 129.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 131A.name: Intermediate Accounting I
MGMT 131A.description: First course in a series of two intermediate-level courses in financial accounting theory and practice. Concepts include the measurement, valuation, and reporting of current and long-term assets, current liabilities, and revenue recognition issues.
MGMT 131A.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 131B.name: Intermediate Accounting II
MGMT 131B.description: Second course in a series of two intermediate-level courses in financial accounting theory and practice. Concepts include the measurement, valuation, and reporting of long-term liabilities and contingencies, accounting for stockholders' equity, and the Statement of Cash Flows.
MGMT 131B.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 131C.name: Intermediate Accounting III
MGMT 131C.description: Third in a three-part series (A, B, and C). Focuses on developing knowledge related to investments, debt/equity issues, accounting for income taxes, pensions, leases, and revenue recognition.
MGMT 131C.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 132A.name: Individual Taxation
MGMT 132A.description: Fundamentals of federal income taxation pertaining to individuals. Topics include income, deductions, credits, property transactions, and the impact of taxes on business and investment decisions.
MGMT 132A.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 133.name: Corporate and Partnership Taxation
MGMT 133.description: Fundamentals of federal income taxation pertaining to partnerships and corporations, including subchapter S corporations. Emphasis on the tax issues associated with formation, operation, and termination of these entities.
MGMT 133.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 134.name: Data Analytics in Accounting
MGMT 134.description: Provides students with an understanding of data types and sources and how to apply and leverage analytical techniques in making financial and managerial accounting decisions.  Business and ethical issues surrounding the collection and use of Big Data are also discussed.

MGMT 136.name: Accounting Information Systems & Spreadsheets
MGMT 136.description: Fundamentals of accounting information systems including internal controls and transaction processing cycles. Development of efficient spreadsheets as applied to financial and managerial accounting concepts.
MGMT 136.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 137.name: Advanced Accounting
MGMT 137.description: Covers advanced concepts in accounting theory and practice. Topics include business combinations, consolidated financial statements, foreign exchange transactions, international, and governmental/nonprofit accounting standards.
MGMT 137.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 138.name: Auditing
MGMT 138.description: An introduction to auditing practice with emphasis on the verification of financial statements and related information. Topics include professional ethics, assessment of audit risk, study and evaluation of internal control, gathering and evaluating audit evidence, and audit reporting.
MGMT 138.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 141.name: Investments
MGMT 141.description: Foundations of investment management.  Theory and empirical evidence related to portfolio theory, market efficiency, asset pricing models, factor models, and option pricing theory. Students are expected to combine market research results and electronic information sources to create optimal investment strategies.
MGMT 141.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 144.name: Multinational Finance
MGMT 144.description: Focuses on financial issues facing multinational corporations, the most important of which is the management of foreign exchange risk. Introduction to investments and financing decisions in international capital markets.
MGMT 144.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT 109 and (ECON 20A or MGMT 4A) and (ECON 20B or MGMT 4B)
MGMT 144.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 145.name: FinTech
MGMT 145.description: Provides working knowledge of economic mechanisms in areas of FinTech. Identifying and analyzing important issues through a balance of qualitative analysis and quantitative applications. Topics covered include Bitcoin, Blockchain, Crowdfunding, peer-to-peer lending, robo-advisor, and their economic and social impacts.
MGMT 145.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 146A.name: Introduction to the Real Estate Process
MGMT 146A.description: Introductory survey course providing a working knowledge of the real estate market, both residential and commercial. Topics include real estate economics, appraisal, feasibility, investment, tax considerations, financing, and development. Lectures and cases, with supplemental presentations by real estate professionals.
MGMT 146A.restriction: Restriction: Upper-division students only. Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 147.name: Applied Financial Valuation
MGMT 147.description: Case study course designed to confront students with real-world financial valuation problems. Situations are chosen to enhance students’ understanding of the application of finance theory. The principal focus is on estimating the value of firms and projects in diverse settings.
MGMT 147.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 149.name: Derivatives
MGMT 149.description: Introduction to financial derivatives. Covers forward contracts, futures, swaps, and options. Applications of these instruments, including pricing and risk management, are emphasized.
MGMT 149.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 150.name: Consumer Behavior
MGMT 150.description: Application of the behavioral sciences to understanding buyer behavior.  Topics include perception, memory, affect, learning, persuasion, motivation, behavioral decision theory, social and culture influences, and managerial implications.
MGMT 150.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 151.name: Marketing Research
MGMT 151.description: Research to aid managerial decisions for products and services
MGMT 151.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 153.name: Sales Management
MGMT 153.description: Designed for students interested in learning about sales force management and personal selling by firms engaged in business-to-business and consumer goods/services marketing. Covers advantages of personal selling, how to perform sales calls, challenges of sales managers, roles of buying centers.
MGMT 153.restriction: Restriction: Business Information Mgmt Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 154.name: Global Marketing
MGMT 154.description: Students are exposed to the challenges and opportunities facing marketers in the international marketplace. Special attention is given to the management of cultural differences in product development, distribution systems, pricing, and promotion.
MGMT 154.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 155.name: Brand Management
MGMT 155.description: Introduction to issues in planning, implementing, and evaluating brand strategies, relevant theories, models, and tools for the making of brand decisions
MGMT 155.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 156.name: Pricing Strategy
MGMT 156.description: Provides a framework for designing and analyzing pricing strategies. Emphasizes role of pricing in the marketing-mix decisions and broader marketing strategy of a firm. Incorporates study of various economic, psychological, competitive, and organizational foundations that enter into effective pricing decisions.
MGMT 156.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 158.name: Digital Media Marketing Strategy
MGMT 158.description: Entails developing digital marketing strategy across numerous digital marketing platforms

MGMT 159.name: Analysis of Marketing Data
MGMT 159.description: Provides opportunity to learn and apply analytical skills to marketing datasets to unveil hidden patterns and truths, to measure and quantify the performance differences between different initiatives, and to inform decision-making in an increasingly digital world.
MGMT 159.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 165.name: U.S. Healthcare Systems
MGMT 165.description: Providers, suppliers, payers, consumers, and the unique market dynamics among these players. Structure, organization, and financing of health care. The health care industry's relationship to the overall economy will be explored.
MGMT 165.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Business Information Mgmt Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 166.name: Business of Medicine
MGMT 166.description: In order to improve the quality and efficiency of health care delivery one must understand the design and management of health care operations. Opportunities for innovation and changes needed to design a simple, accessible, fair, and effective health care system.
MGMT 166.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Business Information Mgmt Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 171.name: Social Media
MGMT 171.description: Covers theoretical aspects and business applications of social media tools including blogs, wikis, social networking platforms, immersive environments, and other social computing technologies. Also covers business value of social-media-enabled processes.
MGMT 171.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Business Information Mgmt Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 172.name: Data and Programming for Analytics
MGMT 172.description: Challenges and teaches students how to handle data that come in a variety of forms and sizes. Guides students through the whole data management process, from initial data acquisition to final data analysis.
MGMT 172.prereqString: Prerequisite: Recommended: Previous experience with programming languages (preferably Python).
MGMT 172.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 173.name: Business Intelligence for Analytical Decisions
MGMT 173.description: BI from both managerial and technical perspectives. Learn to apply a variety of data mining techniques to learn business intelligence embedded in data, and apply that intelligence to run your business more efficiently. These techniques are useful in different areas.
MGMT 173.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 174.name: Business Data Management
MGMT 174.description: Query, manipulate, and understand data and learn about leading edge applications for databases.  Database fundamentals including entity relationship design, creating database tables, normalization, and data querying.  Contemporary applications of database using case studies.  Applications include data warehousing, data mining.
MGMT 174.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 176.name: Digital Strategies
MGMT 176.description: Covers business strategies for firms that make technology products. Insights are applicable not only to industries that make information and technology goods but also to industries that leverage digitization and network effects for their products.

MGMT 178.name: Management of Information Technology
MGMT 178.description: Strategic use and impact of information technology (IT) in organizations. Covers what IT is, and how it works, business value of IT, and IT strategies that organizations can employ to create value.
MGMT 178.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 182.name: Supply Chain Management
MGMT 182.description: Flows of materials and information among all of the firms that contribute to a product or service. Forecasting, demand management, logistical networks, inventory management, supplier contracting, sourcing, information technology, flexibility, globalization, and performance management.
MGMT 182.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 189.name: Operations Management
MGMT 189.description: Managing the productive resources, from which raw materials as inputs are being transformed into useful outputs of final products and services. Explanation of issues pertaining to both manufacturing and services-oriented systems.
MGMT 189.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 190.name: Special Topics in Management
MGMT 190.description: Studies in selected areas of management. Topics addressed vary each quarter.
MGMT 190.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 191W.name: Business Communication
MGMT 191W.description: Provides students with a solid foundation in business communication. Emphasis is placed on improving students' written and oral communication skills to help them succeed in (1) upper-division Business Administration courses, (2) graduate school, and (3) work and career activities.
MGMT 191W.prereqString: Prerequisite: Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.

MGMT 192.name: Business Law
MGMT 192.description: A study of the legal environment of business.  Topics include contracts, agency, partnerships, corporations, and other basic principles of law as they relate to business transactions.
MGMT 192.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 194.name: Financial Statement Analysis
MGMT 194.description: Study of financial statements and their related footnotes
MGMT 194.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 196.name: Decision Analysis
MGMT 196.description: Use of decision analysis digital technologies for multiple objective decisions under certainty
MGMT 196.restriction: Restriction: Business Administration Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MGMT 198A.name: Administrative Internship
MGMT 198A.description: Selected undergraduates serve as managers within administrative units on campus with a three-quarter course which complements the intern experience. Topics include management ethics, study of non- and for-profit institutions, career management, and the changing nature of the workforce.

MGMT 198B.name: Administrative Internship
MGMT 198B.description: Selected undergraduates serve as managers within administrative units on campus with a three-quarter course which complements the intern experience. Topics include management ethics, study of non- and for-profit institutions, career management, and the changing nature of the workforce.

MGMT 198C.name: Administrative Internship
MGMT 198C.description: Selected undergraduates serve as managers within administrative units on campus with a three-quarter course which complements the intern experience. Topics include management ethics, study of non- and for-profit institutions, career management, and the changing nature of the workforce.

MGMT 199.name: Independent Study
MGMT 199.description: Individual study under the direction of a selected faculty member.

MGMT EP 200.name: Thinking Strategically in the Digital Age for Executives
MGMT EP 200.description: Focuses on the strategic and organizational challenges that a rapidly changing environment poses to the firm’s management and frames them according to Merage’s strategic emphasis on analytical decision making, innovation, and information technology.
MGMT EP 200.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 201A.name: Business Analytics: Decision-Making for Executives
MGMT EP 201A.description: Methods of statistical inference, emphasizing applications to administrative and management decision problems. Topics include classical estimation, hypothesis testing, regression, correlation, analysis of variance, decision analysis, and forecasting.
MGMT EP 201A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 202.name: Organizational Leadership for Executives
MGMT EP 202.description: Develops a better understanding of individual and group behavior in and across organizations, and the frameworks by which to analyze and understand behavior in complex organizations. Enhances the skills required to manage collaboration and lead. Every other weekend course.
MGMT EP 202.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 203A.name: Financial Reporting Policies for Executives
MGMT EP 203A.description: Involves the development, analysis, and interpretation of financial accounting information for external reporting purposes. Emphasis on measurement and valuation issues in decision-making problems and cases. Every other weekend course format.
MGMT EP 203A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 203B.name: Managerial Accounting for Executives
MGMT EP 203B.description: Involves developing and using internal financial and non-financial information to help organizations make planning, budgeting, control, operating, and performance evaluation decisions. Every other weekend course format.
MGMT EP 203B.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT EP 203A. MGMT EP 203A with a grade of C or better
MGMT EP 203B.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 204A.name: Microeconomics for Executives in the Digital Age
MGMT EP 204A.description: Provides basic tools for analyzing economic decisions of consumers and firms. Topics include demand and supply analysis, production and cost theory, perfect competition, monopoly, market failures, and introductory game theory.  Every other weekend course format.
MGMT EP 204A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 204B.name: Macroeconomics for Executives
MGMT EP 204B.description: Introduces use of macroeconomic analysis to manage the business cycle for competitive advantage. "Business cycle-sensitive" management is explored within the context of marketing, operations management, HRM, merger and acquisition activity, and capital financing and expenditures. Every other weekend course format.
MGMT EP 204B.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT EP 204A. MGMT EP 204A with a grade of C or better
MGMT EP 204B.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 205.name: Marketing Leadership
MGMT EP 205.description: Introduction to marketing. Topics include developing familiarity with fundamental marketing concepts, theories, and techniques
MGMT EP 205.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 207.name: Competing with Digital: Technology, Analytics, Business Models
MGMT EP 207.description: Focuses on how information technology is used to create value in organizations through product, process, and strategy innovation. Aims to help managers understand the strategic role of key information technologies in managing organizations. Every other weekend course format.
MGMT EP 207.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 208.name: Operational Excellence: Processes, Strategy, and Analytics
MGMT EP 208.description: Introduction to strategic and tactical issues in production and operations management. A blend of quantitative and qualitative considerations. Topics include product planning, process design, capacity management, production planning, inventory control, just-in-time manufacturing, and quality management. Every other weekend course format.
MGMT EP 208.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 209A.name: Managerial Finance for Executives
MGMT EP 209A.description: Introduces students to financial theory and concepts. Topics include time value of money, valuation of stocks and bonds, capital budgeting, portfolio theory, and capital structure choice. Every other weekend course format.
MGMT EP 209A.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT EP 201A and MGMT EP 203A and MGMT EP 204A. MGMT EP 201A with a grade of C or better. MGMT EP 203A with a grade of C or better. MGMT EP 204A with a grade of C or better
MGMT EP 209A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 210.name: Strategy for Executives: Foundations and Dynamics
MGMT EP 210.description: Provides conceptual frameworks and techniques to analyze and develop firm strategies. Through case analysis/discussion, helps improve strategic thinking by developing frameworks by which to assess, evaluate, and respond to different business situations. Every other weekend course format.
MGMT EP 210.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT EP 200 and MGMT EP 202 and MGMT EP 205 and MGMT EP 209A. MGMT EP 200 with a grade of C or better. MGMT EP 202 with a grade of C or better. MGMT EP 205 with a grade of C or better. MGMT EP 209A with a grade of C or better
MGMT EP 210.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 219.name: Practice of General Management for Executives
MGMT EP 219.description: Teaches the graduating MBA how the best managers actually manage. Students develop a toolkit of proven concepts and practices that will help them succeed as managers at any level.
MGMT EP 219.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT EP 225.name: Negotiations For Executives
MGMT EP 225.description: Using a combination of theory and practice via negotiation simulations, students expand their repertoire of negotiating skills and develop their ability to analyze different negotiation situations and contexts. Every other weekend course format.
MGMT EP 225.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT EP 290.name: Special Topics in Business
MGMT EP 290.description: Studies in selected areas of business. Topics addressed vary each quarter.
MGMT EP 290.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT EP 295A.name: Global Business I for Executives
MGMT EP 295A.description: Fundamentals of global strategy, economics, and financial issues. Topics include global manager’s environment, global strategy, impact of national culture on business systems, strategies and practices, foreign direct investment, corporate governance, human resources, and international marketing. Every other weekend course format.
MGMT EP 295A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 295B.name: Global Business II for Executives
MGMT EP 295B.description: Emphasizes and reinforces international perspectives contained in the M.B.A. curriculum by providing a week-long intensive seminar abroad in the second year. Scholars and business people from the host country instruct Executive M.B.A. students in designed class sessions and company visits.
MGMT EP 295B.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 296.name: Executive Leadership
MGMT EP 296.description: Focuses on the conceptual, practical, and personal dimensions of executive leadership. Past and current leadership theories are addressed. Individual personal assessment and diagnosis. Every other weekend course format.
MGMT EP 296.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Executive Majors only.

MGMT EP 299.name: Individual Study
MGMT EP 299.description: Individual Study under the direction of a selected faculty member.
MGMT EP 299.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 200.name: Thinking Strategically in the Digital Age for Managers
MGMT FE 200.description: Focuses on the strategic and organizational challenges that a rapidly changing environment poses to the firm’s management and frames them according to Merage’s strategic emphasis on analytical decision making, innovation, and information technology.
MGMT FE 200.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 201A.name: Business Analytics: Decision-Making for Managers
MGMT FE 201A.description: Methods of statistical inference, emphasizing applications to administrative and management decision problems. Topics include classical estimation, hypothesis testing, regression, correlation, analysis of variance, decision analysis, and forecasting. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 201A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 201B.name: Management Science for Managers
MGMT FE 201B.description: Uses both prescriptive analysis and risk analysis to explore linear programming models, network problems, and simulation. The goal is to introduce and help students acquire some skills of logical thinking with formal models and improve students’ decision making capability.
MGMT FE 201B.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 202.name: Organizational Leadership for Managers
MGMT FE 202.description: Develops a better understanding of individual and group behavior in and across organizations
MGMT FE 202.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 203A.name: Financial Reporting for Managers
MGMT FE 203A.description: Involves the development, analysis, and interpretation of financial accounting information for external reporting purposes. Emphasis on measurement and valuation issues in decision-making problems and cases. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 203A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 203B.name: Driving Profitability Through Managerial Accounting
MGMT FE 203B.description: Teaches skills for making vital strategic and tactical decisions (e.g., outsourcing
MGMT FE 203B.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT FE 203A or MGMTMBA 203A. MGMT FE 203A with a grade of C or better. MGMTMBA 203A with a grade of C or better
MGMT FE 203B.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 204A.name: Microeconomics for Managers in the Digital Age
MGMT FE 204A.description: Provides basic tools for analyzing economic decisions, the determinants and consequences of market structure and market failure. Topics include demand and supply analysis, production and cost theory, perfect competition, monopoly, and introductory game theory. Evening and weekend course format.
MGMT FE 204A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 204B.name: Macroeconomics for Managers
MGMT FE 204B.description: Introduces use of macroeconomic analysis to manage the business cycle for competitive advantage. "Business cycle-sensitive" management is explored within the context of marketing, operations management, HRM, merger and acquisition activity, and capital financing and expenditures. Evening and weekend course format.
MGMT FE 204B.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Business Administration Majors only.

MGMT FE 205.name: Marketing Management
MGMT FE 205.description: Introduction to marketing. Develops familiarity with fundamental concepts, theories, and techniques in marketing and acquaints students with the type of decisions made by marketing managers including customer targeting, product, pricing, placement, promotion, and research. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 205.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 207.name: Competing with Digital
MGMT FE 207.description: Focuses on the technological and managerial issues surrounding the development and use of IT in organizations. Examines how technology can be used to execute an organization's business strategy and to enable new, innovative business strategies. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 207.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 208.name: Operational Excellence: Processes, Principles, and Analytics
MGMT FE 208.description: Introduction to strategic and tactical issues in production and operations management. Blend of quantitative and qualitative considerations. Topics include product planning, process design, capacity management, production planning, inventory control, distribution management, just-in-time manufacturing, quality management. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 208.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 209A.name: Finance for Managers
MGMT FE 209A.description: Introduces students to financial theory and concepts. Topics include time value of money, valuation of stocks and bonds, capital budgeting, portfolio theory, and capital structure choice. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 209A.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT FE 201A and MGMT FE 203A and MGMT FE 204A
MGMT FE 209A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 209B.name: Investments for Managers
MGMT FE 209B.description: Foundations of investment management. Theory and empirical evidence related to portfolio theory, market efficiency, and valuation models for equities, bonds, and options. Emphasis on practical applications, including optimal investment strategies. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 209B.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 210.name: Strategy for Managers: Foundations and Dynamics
MGMT FE 210.description: Provides conceptual frameworks and techniques to analyze and develop firm strategies. Through case analysis and discussion, helps improve strategic thinking by developing frameworks by which to assess, evaluate, and respond to different business situations. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 210.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT FE 200 and MGMT FE 202 and MGMT FE 205 and MGMT FE 209A
MGMT FE 210.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 211.name: Networks, Platforms, and Ecosystems
MGMT FE 211.description: Focuses on unique strategic issues raised by multi-sided platform businesses that facilitate interaction among different parties. Combining economic theory and case examples to unpack subtle factors making multi-sided businesses different. From value propositions to pricing strategies to design decisions.
MGMT FE 211.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 214.name: Entrepreneurship
MGMT FE 214.description: A project course in which student teams develop a business plan to launch a new venture. Drafts of sections of the plan are due throughout the course. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 214.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 215.name: Strategy in a Digital Age
MGMT FE 215.description: Focuses on applying unchanging basic principles of strategy, economics, and organization to digital technologies. Studies historical and contemporary competitive situations to work out key underlying digital mechanisms that shape competition over time.
MGMT FE 215.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 217.name: Competitive Intelligence for Managers
MGMT FE 217.description: Focuses on how to design a competitive intelligence program, which is a core foundation upon which competitive strategies and execution tactics are developed, assessed, and modified. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 217.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 219.name: Practice of General Management
MGMT FE 219.description: Designed to teach the graduating M.B.A. students how the best managers actually manage. Students will develop a toolkit of proven concepts and practices that will help them succeed as managers at any level.
MGMT FE 219.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 220.name: Organizational Change in a Digital World for Managers
MGMT FE 220.description: Focuses on the implementation of change. Identifies the features of successful changes in organizations of varying sizes and configurations, with an emphasis on the reasons why individuals resist or embrace change. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 220.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 222.name: Performance Management in 21st Century Organizations
MGMT FE 222.description: The key to sustained competitive advantage in a 21st century organization. Performance management is all about aligning employee attitudes and behaviors with firm goals and performance.
MGMT FE 222.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 225.name: Negotiations For Managers
MGMT FE 225.description: Using a combination of theory and practice via negotiation simulations, students expand their repertoire of negotiating skills and develop their ability to analyze different negotiation situations and contexts. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 225.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 227.name: Global Negotiations
MGMT FE 227.description: Emphasizes economic, political, social, and cultural environments of international business negotiations. Topics include self-assessment/analysis, environmental analysis, international team building, negotiation processes and strategies, resources, skills, pre-negotiation preparations, agreements, and post-contract negotiations. Specific emphasis will be placed on cross-cultural problem-solving.

MGMT FE 228.name: International Management for Managers
MGMT FE 228.description: Introduction to the effects of different national cultures, and political and economic systems on the assumptions, expectations, organizational practices, and organizational forms needed to conduct cross-national organizational work. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 228.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 231A.name: Financial Statement Analysis and Valuation for Managers I
MGMT FE 231A.description: Develops skills essential to using financial statements for business analysis by examining financial information quality, profitability and risk analysis, earnings management, revenue recognition, asset recognition and valuation, and how financial reporting is related to the business environment and managerial incentives.
MGMT FE 231A.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT FE 203A or MGMTMBA 203A. MGMT FE 203A with a grade of C or better. MGMTMBA 203A with a grade of C or better
MGMT FE 231A.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 231B.name: Financial Statement Analysis and Valuation for Managers II
MGMT FE 231B.description: Focuses on the financial statement analysis of liabilities and stockholders' equity. Topics include forecasting financial statements, earnings-based valuation models, accounting analysis of mergers and acquisitions, leases, bankruptcy prediction, and derivatives. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 231B.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT FE 203A or MGMTMBA 203A. MGMT FE 203A with a grade of C or better. MGMTMBA 203A with a grade of C or better
MGMT FE 231B.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 233.name: Wealth Management for Managers
MGMT FE 233.description: Aims to integrate behavioral finance, psychology, personal financial planning, risk management, and asset management to provide students with the theoretical and practical knowledge to effectively build and manage wealth.
MGMT FE 233.restriction: Restriction: Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 245.name: FinTech and the Digital Economy
MGMT FE 245.description: Provides working knowledge of the role of IT-enabled innovation in financial markets to help students acquire an understanding of broad economic issues that are of wide applicability in many areas of FinTech. Both qualitative analysis and quantitative applications are explored.
MGMT FE 245.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 246A.name: Introduction to the Real Estate Process
MGMT FE 246A.description: Introductory survey course providing an understanding of the real estate market. Topics include real estate economics, valuation, feasibility, investment, tax considerations, financing, development, and corporate real estate asset management. Hands-on lectures, with guest lectures by real estate professionals.
MGMT FE 246A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 246B.name: International Real Estate
MGMT FE 246B.description: Survey of international real estate investment opportunities. Topics include size and breadth
MGMT FE 246B.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 246C.name: Real Estate Capital Markets
MGMT FE 246C.description: Understanding the four sectors of real estate capital markets: pubic debt, private debt, public equity, private equity

MGMT FE 246D.name: The Real Estate Development Process
MGMT FE 246D.description: Nature and composition of development community and development process. Emphasis on role of conflicting interests, values and goals, and market uncertainty. Special attention paid to deal structuring and risk management. Lectures, guest lecturers, team projects evaluating actual development project.
MGMT FE 246D.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 246F.name: Seminar in Management of the Real Estate Enterprise
MGMT FE 246F.description: Beyond "The Deal" to management of the real estate enterprise itself. Explores aspects of decision-making focused upon strategic objectives: goal setting, legal/tax structures, family-owned firms, going public, corporate ethics, capital structure, diversification, core competencies, technology. Guest professionals.
MGMT FE 246F.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 246G.name: Applied Real Estate Security Analysis and Portfolio Management
MGMT FE 246G.description: Provides an understanding of the public real estate investment trust (REIT) market and its place in modern investment strategies, presents methods for analyzing and valuing companies, and introduces basic concepts for constructing and managing a real estate investment portfolio.
MGMT FE 246G.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 247.name: Venture Capital and Private Equity for Managers
MGMT FE 247.description: Geared to students who are seeking a career in finance and/or in working with venture capital firms, private equity/buyout firms, investment banks, commercial lenders, mezzanine fund investors, corporate finance, and entrepreneurial firms.
MGMT FE 247.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 249.name: Derivatives for Managers
MGMT FE 249.description: Studies financial derivatives instruments, including forward contracts, futures, swaps, and options. Advanced applications of these instruments, including pricing and risk management, are emphasized. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 249.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 251A.name: Marketing Research for Managers
MGMT FE 251A.description: Qualitative and quantitative marketing techniques that generate customer insights. Discusses problem formulation, data collection, statistical analyses, formulating managerial recommendations, implementation, and how research is used by companies. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 251A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 252A.name: Managing Advertising and Communications
MGMT FE 252A.description: Integrated marketing communications, including advertising, sale promotions, public relations, and direct mail. Exposure to elements of a communications plan
MGMT FE 252A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 255.name: Business to Business Selling and Sales Management
MGMT FE 255.description: Sales is the interpersonal process where the needs of the buyer are uncovered and satisfied, to the long-term benefit of both parties. Students explore sales force management and personal selling in a dynamic, digital environment.
MGMT FE 255.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 257.name: Marketing on the Internet for Managers
MGMT FE 257.description: Examines the Internet's impact on traditional methods of marketing. Discusses how to capitalize on and increase the Internet's utility as a tool that can increase marketing effectiveness, efficiency, and competitiveness. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 257.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 259.name: Strategic Brand Management for Managers
MGMT FE 259.description: Addresses important branding decisions faced by organizations. A computer simulation allows students hands-on experience in making decisions about their brand and seeing the results of those decisions. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 259.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 273.name: Business Intelligence for Analytical Decisions for Managers
MGMT FE 273.description: Introduces methods to mine data repositories for business intelligence to facilitate analytical decision-making. Topics include clustering for market segmentation
MGMT FE 273.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 278.name: Data and Programming for Analytics
MGMT FE 278.description: Challenges and teaches students to handle data that come in a variety of forms and sizes. Guides students through the whole data management process, from initial data acquisition to final data analysis.
MGMT FE 278.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 279.name: Digital Strategies and Markets
MGMT FE 279.description: Examines how online social media are impacting organizations and markets. Topics include collective intelligence, online social influence, social networks, and social media monetization. The target audience consists of students interested in IT consulting, competitive strategy, marketing, and entrepreneurship.
MGMT FE 279.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 281.name: Analytical Decision Models for Managers
MGMT FE 281.description: An introduction of analytics tools for decision making. Topics include linear and non-linear optimization and simulation models. Excel Solver will be used as the optimization tool and Risk Solver Platform will be used as the simulation tool. Evening or weekend.
MGMT FE 281.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 283.name: Decision Analysis for Managers
MGMT FE 283.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 285.name: Supply Chain Analytics for Managers
MGMT FE 285.description: Introduces students to fundamental analytics tools to manage business uncertainties, meet customer needs, and drive business disruptions through supply chain innovations. Example topics include forecasting, inventory management, capacity planning, profit analysis, supply chain coordination, risk management, simulation-based performance analysis.
MGMT FE 285.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 288.name: Predictive Analytics
MGMT FE 288.description: Deals with predicting entities, such as demand for a product or service (forecasting) and predicting membership of known groups (classification). Blends methodologies of forecasting and data mining and focuses on the application of these methods to managerial problems and decision-making.

MGMT FE 290.name: Special Topics in Business
MGMT FE 290.description: Studies in selected areas of Business. Topics addressed vary each quarter.
MGMT FE 290.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 292.name: Business Law for Managers
MGMT FE 292.description: Detailed study from a business viewpoint of contract theories, assignments, delegation of duties, third-party beneficiary contracts, defenses to consensual contracts, types of conditions, methods of excusing conditions, remedies, and types of damages. Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 292.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 293.name: Information, Communication, and Coordination: Practicum for Analyzing Organizations
MGMT FE 293.description: Use of contextual inquiry and ethnographic methods to assess real world contexts.  Exploring culture, power, physical layout, and the role of artifacts in information flow, communication practices, and coordination through qualitative fieldwork in an organization.
MGMT FE 293.restriction: Restriction: Master of Business Admin Degree students only. Graduate students only.

MGMT FE 294.name: EDGE for Managers
MGMT FE 294.description: Explores the crucial roles of external forces: globalization, technology, shifting demographics - as transformative catalysts for change - opening markets, erasing boundaries, and transforming industries. This course prepares future business leaders to innovate and successfully compete.
MGMT FE 294.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 295A.name: Introduction to Global Business for Managers
MGMT FE 295A.description: Fundamentals of global strategy, economics, and financial issues. Topics include global manager’s environment, global strategy, impact of national culture on business systems, strategies and practices, foreign direct investment, corporate governance, human resources, and international marketing. Evening and weekend course format.
MGMT FE 295A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 295B.name: Global Business for Managers
MGMT FE 295B.description: Emphasizes and reinforces international perspectives contained in the FEMBA curriculum by providing a week-long intensive seminar abroad in the second year.  Scholars and business people from the host country instruct FEMBA students in specially designed class sessions and company visits.
MGMT FE 295B.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT FE 295A. MGMT FE 295A with a grade of B or better
MGMT FE 295B.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Admin - Fully Employed Majors only.

MGMT FE 296.name: Executive Leadership
MGMT FE 296.description: Provides perspectives on leadership. Helps students answer three questions: Where am I currently as a leader? What tools can I use to improve my leadership? What is my plan for the future as a leader? Evening or weekend course format.
MGMT FE 296.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 298.name: Merage Consulting Projects for Managers
MGMT FE 298.description: Provides students the opportunity to put into practice concepts, skills, and tools acquired in other parts of the MBA program. Seminars augment internship experiences with analyses of relevant administrative issues.
MGMT FE 298.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT FE 299.name: Individual Directed Study
MGMT FE 299.description: Individual study under the direction of a selected faculty member.
MGMT FE 299.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT HC 201B.name: Operations Analytics for Healthcare Executives
MGMT HC 201B.description: An introduction to computer-based models for decision making. Topics include optimization (linear programming, integer programming, network flow models) and computer simulation. Uses spreadsheets extensively, including Excel built-in and add-in packages. Once a month weekend course format.
MGMT HC 201B.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Health Care Majors only.

MGMT HC 203A.name: Financial Reporting for Healthcare Executives
MGMT HC 203A.description: Involves the development, analysis, and interpretation of financial accounting information for external reporting purposes. Emphasis on measurement and valuation issues in decision-making problems and cases.  Once a month weekend course format.
MGMT HC 203A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Health Care Majors only.

MGMT HC 203B.name: Managerial Accounting for Healthcare Executives
MGMT HC 203B.description: Involves developing and using internal financial and non-financial information to help organizations make planning, budgeting, control, operating, and performance evaluation decisions.  Once a month weekend course format.
MGMT HC 203B.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Health Care Majors only.

MGMT HC 206.name: Business and Government for Healthcare Executives
MGMT HC 206.description: Introduces students to the many non-market issues that affect today's managers: environment protection, health and safety, intellectual property protection, antitrust, and lobbying. Takes an interdisciplinary approach using economics, political science, public policy, and law. Once a month weekend course format.
MGMT HC 206.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Health Care Majors only.

MGMT HC 207.name: Competing with Digital in Healthcare: Analytics, Platforms, and Business Models
MGMT HC 207.description: Focuses on how information technology is used to create value in healthcare-related organizations through product, process, and strategy innovation. Aims to help managers and healthcare professionals understand the strategic role of technology. Every other weekend course format.
MGMT HC 207.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Health Care Majors only.

MGMT HC 209A.name: Managerial Finance for Healthcare Executives
MGMT HC 209A.description: Introduces students to financial theory and concepts. Topics include time value of money, valuation of stocks and bonds, capital budgeting, portfolio theory, capital structure choice. Once a month weekend course format.
MGMT HC 209A.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT HC 201A and MGMT HC 203A and MGMT HC 204A
MGMT HC 209A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Health Care Majors only.

MGMT HC 210.name: Strategic Management for Healthcare Executives
MGMT HC 210.description: Provides conceptual frameworks and techniques to analyze and develop firm strategies. Through case analysis and discussion, helps students improve analytical and strategic thinking by which to assess, evaluate, and respond to different business situations. Once a month weekend course format.
MGMT HC 210.prereqString: Prerequisite: MGMT HC 200 and MGMT HC 202 and MGMT HC 205 and MGMT HC 209A
MGMT HC 210.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Health Care Majors only.

MGMT HC 225.name: Negotiations For Healthcare Executives
MGMT HC 225.description: Using a combination of theory and practice via negotiation simulations, students expand their repertoire of negotiating skills and develop their ability to analyze different negotiation situations and contexts. Once a month weekend course format.
MGMT HC 225.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT HC 267.name: Understanding Managed Care
MGMT HC 267.description: This course is designed to increase understanding of the various concepts of managed health care with an emphasis on the organizational processes required to make it work, and explore the economics and financial pressures these organizations face.
MGMT HC 267.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT HC 290.name: Special Topics in Business
MGMT HC 290.description: Studies in selected areas of business. Topics addressed vary each quarter.
MGMT HC 290.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Master of Business Admin Degree students only.

MGMT HC 295.name: Federal Policy in Health Care
MGMT HC 295.description: National/international one-week residential course exploring political analysis as related to management of health care organizations.  Topics include political environment of management, concepts, and processes central to political analysis, bureaucratic politics, politics, and the manager.
MGMT HC 295.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Health Care Majors only.

MGMT HC 296.name: Leadership for Healthcare Executives
MGMT HC 296.description: Focuses on the conceptual, practical, and personal dimensions of executive leadership. Past and current leadership theories are addressed. Individual personal assessment and diagnosis. Once a month weekend course format.
MGMT HC 296.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Administration - Health Care Majors only.

MGMTMBA 200.name: Thinking Strategically in the Digital Age
