MUSIC 142.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 142W.name: Topics in Baroque Music
MUSIC 142W.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 40B. MUSIC 40B with a grade of D or better. Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.
MUSIC 142W.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 143.name: Topics in Classical Music
MUSIC 143.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 40C. MUSIC 40C with a grade of D or better. Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.
MUSIC 143.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 143W.name: Topics in Classical Music
MUSIC 143W.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 40C. MUSIC 40C with a grade of D or better. Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.
MUSIC 143W.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 144.name: Topics in Romantic Music
MUSIC 144.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 40C. MUSIC 40C with a grade of D or better. Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.
MUSIC 144.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 144W.name: Topics in Romantic Music
MUSIC 144W.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 40C. MUSIC 40C with a grade of D or better. Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.

MUSIC 145.name: Topics in 20th Century Music
MUSIC 145.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 40D. MUSIC 40D with a grade of D or better. Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.
MUSIC 145.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 145W.name: Topics in 20th Century Music
MUSIC 145W.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 40D. MUSIC 40D with a grade of D or better. Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.
MUSIC 145W.restriction: Restriction: Upper-division students only. Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 146.name: Studies in Jazz Music
MUSIC 146.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 147.name: Studies in Music Technology
MUSIC 147.description: Specialized topics in electronic music, computer-aided music, and other aspects of music technology.

MUSIC 148.name: Studies in Ethnomusicology
MUSIC 148.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 149.name: Studies in Music History
MUSIC 149.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 40B and MUSIC 40C and MUSIC 40D. Satisfactory completion of the lower-division writing requirement.
MUSIC 149.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 150.name: Composition
MUSIC 150.description: Exercises and projects for diverse instrumental-vocal combinations
MUSIC 150.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 151.name: Computer Music Composition
MUSIC 151.description: Exercises in the composition of music uniquely possible by computer, including digital signal processing, computer control of synthesizers and processors, and algorithmic composition. Demonstrations and musical analyses in class

MUSIC 152.name: Interactive Arts Programming
MUSIC 152.description: Study of artistic issues and programming techniques involved in the development of interactive computer art and music. Theoretical background, basic tenets of programming, and practical exercises in programming interactive computer multimedia art.
MUSIC 152.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 51 or ART 65A or DANCE 163

MUSIC 153.name: Counterpoint
MUSIC 153.description: Studies in contrapuntal practices of various style periods such as the 16th, 18th, and 20th centuries.
MUSIC 153.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 16B. MUSIC 16B with a grade of C- or better
MUSIC 153.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 155.name: Analysis
MUSIC 155.description: Methods of formal analysis applicable to all Western musical styles: additive, continuous, transformational, and hierarchic forms
MUSIC 155.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 156A.name: Song Literature
MUSIC 156A.description: A survey of song literature.  Designed as an overview of the song repertoire, German Lieder.
MUSIC 156A.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 156B.name: Song Literature
MUSIC 156B.description: A survey of song literature.  Designed as an overview of the song repertoire, French mélodie.
MUSIC 156B.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 157.name: Advanced Study in Composition
MUSIC 157.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 150. MUSIC 150 with a grade of C- or better
MUSIC 157.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 158A.name: Diction
MUSIC 158A.description: In-depth study of the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA), including its transcription and pronunciation, and its application for singers.  Introduction to IPA and Italian Diction.
MUSIC 158A.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 158B.name: Diction
MUSIC 158B.description: In-depth study of the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA), including its transcription and pronunciation, and its application for singers. German Diction.
MUSIC 158B.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 158C.name: Diction
MUSIC 158C.description: In-depth study of the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA), including its transcription and pronunciation, and its application for singers. French Diction.
MUSIC 158C.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 159.name: Vocal Pedagogy
MUSIC 159.description: Survey about the physical structure of the singing mechanism, science, and philosophy of studio instruction.

MUSIC 160.name: University Orchestra
MUSIC 160.description: Study and performance of standard orchestral repertory and works by contemporary composers.  Membership is open to all qualified students by audition only.

MUSIC 161.name: Wind Ensemble
MUSIC 161.description: Study and performance of works written for varying combinations of wind and percussion instruments.  Membership is open to all qualified students by audition only.

MUSIC 162.name: University Chorus
MUSIC 162.description: Make-up of the ensembles varies and may include University Chorus, Chamber Choir, Madrigal Singers, Women's Chorus, and Reading Choir. Membership is open to all qualified students by audition only.

MUSIC 162P.name: University Chorus: Accompanying
MUSIC 162P.description: Keyboard accompanying for one of the UCI choral organizations, with individual coaching in sight reading, score reading, and other accompanying skills.

MUSIC 164.name: Opera Workshop
MUSIC 164.description: Preparation and performance of operatic repertoire, including arias, scenes, and fully staged operas, and/or stage training and role analysis.
MUSIC 164.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 164P.name: Opera Workshop: Accompanying
MUSIC 164P.description: Training in techniques and operatic repertory for keyboard players.

MUSIC 166P.name: String Accompaniment
MUSIC 166P.description: Chamber ensemble experience with the solo string repertory for keyboard, participation in the weekly string master class, performance in public recitals.

MUSIC 170.name: Guitar, Lute, and Other Plucked Instruments for Music Performance Majors
MUSIC 170.description: Private weekly lessons and a weekly master class/workshop for the discussion of solo repertory and performance practice, including special topics such as historical notational systems, traditional American guitar styles, and demonstrations of period plucked instruments. Materials fee.

MUSIC 171.name: Chamber Singers
MUSIC 171.description: A select ensemble specializing in vocal chamber music from all periods.  Frequent performances on and off campus.  Membership is open to all singers by audition.

MUSIC 176.name: Chamber Ensembles
MUSIC 176.description: Make-up of the ensembles varies and may include various Classical ensembles, Latin Jazz Ensemble, Small Jazz Combos, Percussion Ensemble, and Guitar Ensemble.  Membership is open to all qualified students by audition only.
MUSIC 176.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Music - Performance Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

MUSIC 178.name: Jazz Orchestra
MUSIC 178.description: Rehearsal and performance of literature written for large jazz ensemble with emphasis on methods and materials.  Laboratory setting for new arrangers and/or composers of modern jazz pieces.

MUSIC 181.name: Improvisation
MUSIC 181.description: Improvisation has been central to all music traditions. Course explores real-time music-making in a variety of non-notated contexts. Different improvisational styles are presented, including jazz, Asian improvisation, and experimental modern music. Emphasis on actual classroom performance.
MUSIC 181.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 182.name: Advanced Jazz Combo
MUSIC 182.description: Small-group jazz ensemble and improvisational workshop.  Range of music covered encompasses the full traditional jazz from improvised ragtime up through the most current avant-garde musical techniques.

MUSIC 183A.name: Jazz Composition I
MUSIC 183A.description: Performance and lecture course for writing and performing original jazz compositions.  Emphasis is placed on composing as a way to create new improvisational frameworks. Cyclical forms, modal compositions, blues-oriented compositions, and ballad writing.

MUSIC 183B.name: Jazz Composition II
MUSIC 183B.description: Performance and lecture course for writing and performing original jazz compositions.  Emphasis is placed on composing as a way to create new improvisational frameworks. Non-functional harmony, contemporary forms, free-bop, and current trends.
MUSIC 183B.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 78 and MUSIC 132 and MUSIC 183A

MUSIC 183C.name: Jazz Composition III
MUSIC 183C.description: Performance and lecture course for writing and performing original jazz compositions.  Emphasis is placed on composing as a way to create new improvisational frameworks. Study of modern tonal-center compositions, intervallic compositions, and alternate rhythms.
MUSIC 183C.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 78 and MUSIC 132 and MUSIC 183A and MUSIC 183B

MUSIC 189.name: Accompanying for Plucked Strings: Continuo and Changes
MUSIC 189.description: Students apply theory to their instruments as they learn the basics of pre-1800 continuo playing and post-1900 jazz charts. Includes discussions of appropriate repertory, treatment of harmonic progressions, and finer points of style and technique.
MUSIC 189.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 191.name: Tutorial in Music
MUSIC 191.description: Supplemental instruction related to student's area of study. Taken only when the materials studied lie outside regular departmental offerings, and when the student has no formal chance to pursue the subject.

MUSIC 193.name: Conducting
MUSIC 193.description: Introduces students to the basic techniques employed in the practice of conducting and includes score study and development of leadership skills.
MUSIC 193.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 16D and MUSIC 40B and MUSIC 40C
MUSIC 193.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 195A.name: Senior Thesis
MUSIC 195A.description: With consultation in regularly scheduled meetings, students identify and study relevant texts and materials and prepare a prospectus for an original thesis.
MUSIC 195A.prereqString: Prerequisite: Senior standing in the Honors Program in Music and Culture.
MUSIC 195A.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 195B.name: Senior Thesis
MUSIC 195B.description: Students submit an outline and preliminary drafts of section of their thesis to the instructor, on a schedule supervised by the instructor. The final version will address the instructor's comments and criticisms.
MUSIC 195B.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 197.name: Word and Music
MUSIC 197.description: Performance class for advanced singers and pianists with emphasis on collaborative approach to vocal literature.
MUSIC 197.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 199.name: Independent Study
MUSIC 199.description: Student-devised research/composition project, with faculty guidance, resulting in a formal paper/project. Taken only when materials studied lie outside regular departmental offerings or when students have no formal chance to pursue the subject.
MUSIC 199.prereqString: Prerequisite: Undergraduate or graduate advisor approval required.
MUSIC 199.restriction: Restriction: Music Majors only. Music - Performance Majors only.

MUSIC 200.name: Bibliography and Research
MUSIC 200.description: Required of all entering students.  A systematic introduction to the bibliographical tools both in the general field of music and in the student's areas of specialization.
MUSIC 200.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 201.name: Topics in Analysis
MUSIC 201.description: Seminar focusing on different analytical methods, modal, tonal, and post-tonal, and their applications to repertories drawn from various historical periods through to the present day.
MUSIC 201.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 202.name: Proseminar in Musicology
MUSIC 202.description: Introduces significant issues and recent developments in musicology and music criticism, including exposure to the controversies that have brought change and reflection to the discipline.

MUSIC 203.name: Music Thesis
MUSIC 203.description: Intensive work dedicated to researching and writing a Master's thesis under the supervision of a faculty advisor.
MUSIC 203.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 200. MUSIC 200 with a grade of B or better
MUSIC 203.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 204.name: Proseminar in Music Theory and Analysis
MUSIC 204.description: Introduction to music theories, analytic approaches, and methodologies as applied to repertories drawn from Western art and popular music.

MUSIC 209.name: Seminar in Creative Practices
MUSIC 209.description: Core first-year seminar required for graduate students in the Integrated Composition, Improvisation, and Technology emphasis of the M.A. and Ph.D. programs. Composition and presentation of original student works, lecture, and discussion.
MUSIC 209.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 210.name: Choral Conducting
MUSIC 210.description: Intensive private instruction and study of the various choral literatures.
MUSIC 210.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 211.name: Performance
MUSIC 211.description: Contents vary according to the student's major instrument. Intensive private instruction and study of the various literatures.
MUSIC 211.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 212.name: Composition
MUSIC 212.description: Intensive work in composition geared to each student's level of competence.
MUSIC 212.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 213.name: Orchestral Conducting
MUSIC 213.description: Intensive private instruction in instrumental conducting.
MUSIC 213.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 214.name: Graduate Recital
MUSIC 214.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 215A.name: Computer Music Composition and Production
MUSIC 215A.description: Study of the composition and production of music made uniquely possible by the computer, including usage of prevalent digital music technology, techniques of digital signal processing, and computer control of synthesizers and audio processors.
MUSIC 215A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 215B.name: Computer Music Programming
MUSIC 215B.description: Study of the artistic issues and programming techniques involved in the development of original applications for computer music composition and interactive performance.
MUSIC 215B.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 220.name: Seminar in Music History
MUSIC 220.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 222.name: Topics in Musicology
MUSIC 222.description: Focuses on current scholarship in musicology and related fields with a strong critical content. Addresses topics relative to their historical and stylistic periods. Recent topics have included Stravinsky, Holy Women, Mahler, Historiography, Issues in Performance Practice, and Brahms’s Chamber Music.

MUSIC 224.name: Seminar in Music Theory and Analysis
MUSIC 224.description: Typical topics include Schenkerian theory and analysis, contemporary form theory, and advanced techniques in the analysis of late 19th-century and contemporary music (e.g., transformational theory, Neo-Riemannian, and scale network theory).

MUSIC 230.name: Seminar in Contemporary Music
MUSIC 230.description: Special seminar projects dealing with contemporary music with emphasis on analytical techniques and style criticism.
MUSIC 230.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 231.name: Improvisation
MUSIC 231.description: Introduces the practice and history of improvisation in diverse fields of Western music since 1950. Performance projects and group critiques, weekly reading and listening assignments, participation in a class concert, and a research paper.
MUSIC 231.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 235.name: Critical Studies in Music
MUSIC 235.description: A critical examination of music traditions, institutions, and aesthetics, employing new scholarship in music and new critical studies in other disciplines.
MUSIC 235.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 236.name: Theoretical ICIT Seminar
MUSIC 236.description: Seminar studying new genres and topics that integrate composition, improvisation, new technologies, and non-classical cultures.
MUSIC 236.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 237.name: Practical ICIT Seminar
MUSIC 237.description: Study of new practices and techniques that integrate composition, improvisation, new technologies, and non-classical cultures.
MUSIC 237.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 239.name: Thesis Colloquium
MUSIC 239.description: ICIT students present their thesis work-in-progress for discussion and criticism. Faculty and visiting artists/scholars also present their current work.
MUSIC 239.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 240.name: Graduate Projects
MUSIC 240.description: Substantial projects in performance, conducting, or composition (other than those specifically required for the degree), accompanied by a summary paper.
MUSIC 240.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 242A.name: First-Year Research and Writing Seminar I
MUSIC 242A.description: Guided reading for one quarter on a broad subject selected by the instructor, followed by one quarter in which the student undertakes independent research on the selected topic, leading to a substantial term paper.
MUSIC 242A.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 200. MUSIC 200 with a grade of B or better

MUSIC 242B.name: First-Year Research and Writing Seminar II
MUSIC 242B.description: Guided reading for one quarter on a broad subject selected by the instructor, followed by one quarter in which the student undertakes independent research on the selected topic, leading to a substantial term paper.
MUSIC 242B.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 200 and MUSIC 242A. MUSIC 200 with a grade of B or better. MUSIC 242A with a grade of B or better

MUSIC 243A.name: Second-Year Research and Writing Tutorial I
MUSIC 243A.description: In this two-quarter sequence, students gain expertise in a first area of research concentration by undertaking directed reading on a topic of their choice and then writing a paper of near-publishable length and quality on that topic.
MUSIC 243A.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 242B. MUSIC 242B with a grade of B or better

MUSIC 243B.name: Second-Year Research and Writing Tutorial II
MUSIC 243B.description: In this two-quarter sequence, students gain expertise in a first area of research concentration by undertaking directed reading on a topic of their choice and then writing a paper of near-publishable length and quality on that topic.
MUSIC 243B.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 243A. MUSIC 243A with a grade of B or better

MUSIC 244.name: Readings for the Qualifying Examination
MUSIC 244.description: Directed reading in preparation for the Qualifying Examination.
MUSIC 244.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 243B. MUSIC 243B with a grade of B or better

MUSIC 245.name: Prospectus Research
MUSIC 245.description: Research and writing of the Dissertation Prospectus.
MUSIC 245.prereqString: Prerequisite: MUSIC 244. MUSIC 244 with a grade of B or better

MUSIC 250.name: Directed Research
MUSIC 250.description: Preparation for qualifying exams and dissertation, or an individual research project resulting in a substantial paper or comparable documentation of the research results.
MUSIC 250.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 276.name: Contemporary Ensemble
MUSIC 276.description: Chamber ensemble for the performance of contemporary music, including newly composed and improvised forms.
MUSIC 276.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

MUSIC 290.name: Dissertation Research
MUSIC 290.description: Research and writing of a Ph.D. dissertation.

MUSIC 299.name: Independent Study
MUSIC 299.description: Student-devised research/composition project, with faculty guidance, resulting in a formal paper/project. Taken only when materials studied lie outside regular departmental offerings or when students have no formal chance to pursue the subject.
MUSIC 299.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Music Majors only.

NET SYS 201.name: Computer and Communication Networks
NET SYS 201.description: Network architecture of the Internet, telephone networks, cable networks, and cell phone networks. Network performance models. Network performance models. Advanced concepts and implementations of flow and congestion control, addressing, internetworking, forwarding, routing, multiple access, streaming, and quality-of-service.

NET SYS 202.name: Networking Laboratory
NET SYS 202.description: A laboratory-based introduction to basic networking concepts such as addressing, sub-netting, bridging, ARP, and routing. Network simulation and design. Structured around weekly readings and laboratory assignments.

NET SYS 210.name: Advanced Networks
NET SYS 210.description: Design principles of networked systems, advanced routing and congestion control algorithms, network algorithms, network measurement, management, security, Internet economics, and emerging networks.
NET SYS 210.prereqString: Prerequisite: NET SYS 201 or COMPSCI 232 or EECS 248A

NET SYS 230.name: Wireless and Mobile Networking
NET SYS 230.description: Introduction to wireless networking. The focus is on layers 2 and 3 of the OSI reference model, design, performance analysis, and protocols. Topics covered include: an introduction to wireless networking, digital cellular, next generation cellular, wireless LANs, and mobile IP.

NET SYS 240.name: Network and Distributed Systems Security
NET SYS 240.description: Modern computer and networks security: attacks and countermeasures, authentication, identification, data secrecy, data integrity, authorization, access control, computer viruses, network security. Group communication and multicast security techniques. Covers secure e-commerce and applications of public key methods, digital certificates, and credentials.

NET SYS 260.name: Middleware for Networked and Distributed Systems
NET SYS 260.description: Discusses concepts, techniques, and issues in developing distributed systems middleware that provides high performance and Quality of Service for emerging applications. Also covers existing standards (e.g., CORBA, DCOM, Jini, Espeak) and their relative advantages and shortcomings.
NET SYS 260.prereqString: Prerequisite: An undergraduate-level course in operating systems and networks.

NET SYS 295.name: Networked Systems Seminar
NET SYS 295.description: Current research in networked systems. Includes talks by UCI faculty, visiting researchers, and Networked Systems graduate students.

NEURBIO 200A.name: Research in Neurobiology and Behavior
NEURBIO 200A.description: Individual research with Neurobiology and Behavior faculty.
NEURBIO 200A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 200B.name: Research in Neurobiology and Behavior
NEURBIO 200B.description: Individual research with Neurobiology and Behavior faculty.
NEURBIO 200B.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 200C.name: Research in Neurobiology and Behavior
NEURBIO 200C.description: Individual research with Neurobiology and Behavior faculty.
NEURBIO 200C.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 201A.name: Research in Neurobiology and Behavior
NEURBIO 201A.description: Individual research with Neurobiology and Behavior faculty.
NEURBIO 201A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 201B.name: Research in Neurobiology and Behavior
NEURBIO 201B.description: Individual research with Neurobiology and Behavior faculty.
NEURBIO 201B.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 201C.name: Research in Neurobiology and Behavior
NEURBIO 201C.description: Individual research with Neurobiology and Behavior faculty.
NEURBIO 201C.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 202A.name: Foundations of Neuroscience
NEURBIO 202A.description: Intended to expose students to critical reading and analysis of the primary neuroscience literature. Instructors from departments associated with the Interdepartmental Neuroscience Program participate and discuss topics of current interest.

NEURBIO 202B.name: Foundations of Neuroscience
NEURBIO 202B.description: Intended to expose students to critical reading and analysis of the primary neuroscience literature. Instructors from departments associated with the Interdepartmental Neuroscience Program participate and discuss topics of current interest.

NEURBIO 206.name: Molecular Neuroscience
NEURBIO 206.description: Surveys molecular and cellular mechanisms involved in neuronal function, including control of gene expression, post-transcriptional and post-translational processing, RNA and protein targeting, cell death mechanisms, and molecular genetic basis of neurological disorders. Overview of the molecular aspects of developmental neurobiology.
NEURBIO 206.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 207.name: Cellular Neuroscience
NEURBIO 207.description: Neurophysiological and neurochemical mechanisms of electrical and chemical signaling in neurons. Topics include generation of resting- and action-potentials, voltage- and ligand-gated ion channels, second messenger systems, and synaptic transmission and integration.
NEURBIO 207.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 207L.name: Cellular Neuroscience Laboratory
NEURBIO 207L.description: Intensive hands-on laboratory experience of contemporary techniques for studying ion channels and synaptic function. Experiments include microelectrode recording, patch clamp, quantal analysis of synaptic transmission, heterologous expression of genes for channels and receptors, brain slice, and fluorescence calcium imaging.
NEURBIO 207L.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 208.name: Systems Neuroscience
NEURBIO 208.description: Study of the mammalian nervous system at the systems level. Anatomy and physiology of sensory, motor, and integrative functions.
NEURBIO 208.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 209.name: Behavioral Neuroscience
NEURBIO 209.description: Overview of fundamental conceptual and experimental issues in the neurobiology of learning and memory. The approach is a cross-level integration of research in molecular-genetic, cellular, circuit, systems, and behavioral analyses.
NEURBIO 209.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 220.name: Neural Coding, Computation, and Dynamics
NEURBIO 220.description: Theoretical principles and biological mechanisms underlying how brains acquire, assimilate, store, and retrieve information, compute adaptive responses to external inputs, and how knowledge is extracted from experience to generate an internal model of the world.
NEURBIO 220.prereqString: Prerequisite: At least one upper-division course in the field of Neuroscience or one upper-division course in Cognitive Science or Machine Learning.

NEURBIO 221.name: Scientific Presentation Skills
NEURBIO 221.description: A tutorial seminar on developing skills for presenting research to scientific audiences.

NEURBIO 225.name: Rigor, Reproducibility, and Research Methods
NEURBIO 225.description: Understanding key concepts in experimental design, execution, and analysis that enhance or detract from scientific rigor.

NEURBIO 227.name: Bioinformatics and Systems Biology
NEURBIO 227.description: Students learn the fundamentals of bioinformatics, genomic approaches, and Linux and R program in order to analyze RNA-sequencing data.

NEURBIO 228.name: Psychophysiological Methods in Clinical Research
NEURBIO 228.description: Introduces the principal signals of psychophysiology and outlines how measures calculated from these signals can be applied in clinical research and practice.
NEURBIO 228.prereqString: Prerequisite: One graduate or undergraduate course in statistics.

NEURBIO 230.name: Epigenetics in Health and Disease
NEURBIO 230.description: Focuses on the role of chromatin/nuclear structure organization (histone and DNA modification, chromatin remodeling, higher order chromatin structure and nuclear organization) on gene regulation, DNA replication and repair, relevant to development, metabolism, learning and memory, and human disease.
NEURBIO 230.prereqString: Prerequisite: MOL BIO 203 or MOL BIO 204 or NEURBIO 206

NEURBIO 231.name: Clinical and Epidemiological Aspects of Neurodegenerative Diseases
NEURBIO 231.description: Clinical and epidemiological aspects of neurodegenerative disorders causing dementia will be reviewed, including AD, PD, FTD, HD and cerebrovascular disease. Seminar format will include student presentations and group discussion.

NEURBIO 232.name: Regenerative Neurobiology
NEURBIO 232.description: Surveys the latest research on regenerative neurobiology. Both basic stem cell discoveries and their potential clinical application to brain disorders will be examined.

NEURBIO 233.name: Neurobiology of Drug Addiction
NEURBIO 233.description: Provides a comprehensive overview of topics in the addiction field, including drug pharmacology, models/approaches to investigate addiction, brain circuits, genetics, epigenetics, and the cellular and molecular biology of drug addiction.

NEURBIO 236.name: Cortex: Structure, Function, and Plasticity
NEURBIO 236.description: Structured to include lectures and presentation of papers about cortex with emphasis on sensory-motor cortex. Both historical and current perspectives on cortical structure-function relationship will be critically evaluated.

NEURBIO 237.name: Neurobiology of Brain Aging
NEURBIO 237.description: Outlines some of the significant changes that occur in the aging brain, with a special emphasis on risk factors and protective strategies that promote successful brain aging. Topics include changes in synaptic plasticity, neurotrophic factors, and molecular mechanisms in aging.

NEURBIO 239.name: Functional Imaging of the Nervous System
NEURBIO 239.description: Overview of technical and applied aspects of imaging techniques available for studying the nervous system. The areas emphasized are cellular and subcellular imaging of neural function, systems-level imaging of brain function, and imaging of the human brain.
NEURBIO 239.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 240.name: Advanced Analysis of Learning and Memory
NEURBIO 240.description: Advanced analysis of contemporary research concerning the nature and neurobiological bases of learning and memory. Special emphasis is given to time-dependent processes involved in memory storage.
NEURBIO 240.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 247.name: Programming for Neuroscience Research
NEURBIO 247.description: A neuroscience-specific introduction to programming and data analysis using either MATLAB or Scientific PYTHON. Students will learn general programming skills and effective use of programming for data management, statistical analysis, and image analysis.

NEURBIO 248.name: Topics in Neurobiology and Behavior
NEURBIO 248.description: Studies in selected areas of Neurobiology and Behavior. Topics addressed vary each quarter.

NEURBIO 254.name: Molecular Neurobiology
NEURBIO 254.description: The application of genetic and recombinant DNA technology to neurobiology.  Topics include the study of neuronal proteins which play important roles in the formation of synapses and synaptic transmission.
NEURBIO 254.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 255.name: Perspectives in Neuroscience: Past, Present, and Future
NEURBIO 255.description: An overview of the conceptual and technical foundations of contemporary neuroscience from ancient times to the present. The subjects include synapses, neurons, brain organization, sensory, motor and regulatory systems, learning and memory, human brain function and dysfunction.
NEURBIO 255.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 257.name: Statistics for Neurobiologists
NEURBIO 257.description: Introduction to common methods for statistical analysis used in neurobiology. Topics covered include t-tests, ANOVAs, correlations and regressions, general linear model, power analysis, and non-parametric tests.

NEURBIO 260.name: Auditory Neuroscience
NEURBIO 260.description: Multidisciplinary overview of brain mechanisms of hearing. Emphasizes breadth of auditory function and research: single neurons to psychoacoustics, the chochlea to the cortex, and basic science to clinic.

NEURBIO 290.name: Colloquium in Neurobiology and Behavior
NEURBIO 290.description: Presentation of contemporary research problems in neurobiology and behavior and related areas by invited speakers.
NEURBIO 290.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NEURBIO 292.name: Scientific Proposals for Neuroscience Trainees
NEURBIO 292.description: Students learn how to effectively communicate scientific ideas and results. Activities include learning how to effectively write a scientific proposal, how to perform a coherent, persuasive slide presentation, and how to give meaningful, constructive review critiques.
NEURBIO 292.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Neurobiology and Behavior Majors only.

NUR SCI 50.name: Nutrition Across the Lifespan
NUR SCI 50.description: Focuses on the relationship between diet and health, and how the human body responds to different diets and food components. Emphasizes how diet interacts with activity and the impact of exercise or sedentary lifestyle on health.
NUR SCI 50.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

NUR SCI 90.name: Introduction to Pain Medicine
NUR SCI 90.description: Gives students introductory knowledge in pain medicine.

NUR SCI 92.name: Compassion in Health Care
NUR SCI 92.description: An overview of the importance of compassion in health care, providing examples from a variety of health care professions through lectures and discussion.

NUR SCI 110W.name: Frameworks for Professional Nursing Practice
NUR SCI 110W.description: Conceptual frameworks for professional practice. Scope of professional nursing, jurisprudence and ethics, professional interpersonal relationships, and health care delivery systems in the context of the social, political, and economic environments. Socialization of the student for professional roles in nursing.
NUR SCI 110W.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 112LA and NUR SCI 114A and NUR SCI 118A
Prerequisite: BIO SCI D170 and BIO SCI E109. Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.
NUR SCI 110W.restriction: Restriction: Upper-division students only. Nursing Science Majors only.

NUR SCI 112LA.name: Foundations of Professional Practice
NUR SCI 112LA.description: Development of skills in communication, interviewing, functional and physical health assessment across the life span, the art and science of human care, and clinical judgment.
NUR SCI 112LA.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 110W and NUR SCI 114A and NUR SCI 118A
Prerequisite: BIO SCI E109 and BIO SCI D170

NUR SCI 112LB.name: Foundations of Professional Practice
NUR SCI 112LB.description: Development of skills in communication, interviewing, functional and physical health assessment across the life span, the art and science of human care, and clinical judgment.
NUR SCI 112LB.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 114B and NUR SCI 118B and NUR SCI 125 and NUR SCI 135
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 112LA and NUR SCI 110W and NUR SCI 114A and NUR SCI 118A

NUR SCI 114A.name: Applied Pharmacology I
NUR SCI 114A.description: Presents principles of pharmacology applied to interventions in pathophysiologic states across the life span. Discussion of the major drug groups with implications for monitoring, drug administration, toxicity, and patient education are included.
NUR SCI 114A.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 110W and NUR SCI 118A and NUR SCI 112LA
Prerequisite: BIO SCI E109 and BIO SCI D170

NUR SCI 114B.name: Applied Pharmacology II
NUR SCI 114B.description: Presents principles of pharmacology applied to interventions in pathophysiologic states across the life span. Discussion of the major drug groups with implications for monitoring, drug administration, toxicity, and patient education are included.
NUR SCI 114B.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 118B and NUR SCI 112LB and NUR SCI 125 and NUR SCI 135
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 114A and NUR SCI 118A and NUR SCI 110W and NUR SCI 112LA

NUR SCI 116.name: Human Growth and Development through the Lifespan
NUR SCI 116.description: Examines theories and concepts of typical human development throughout the life cycle, from the time of conception through adulthood, and familiarizes students with the many forces that shape individual development, including family, society, and culture.
NUR SCI 116.prereqString: Prerequisite: PSYCH 7A or PSCI 9. PSYCH 7A with a grade of C or better. PSCI 9 with a grade of C or better

NUR SCI 118A.name: Human Health and Disease I
NUR SCI 118A.description: Presents content on pathologic alterations in physiologic processes in cells, tissues, organs, and systems across the life span. Emphasis on critical thinking, application of concepts to clinical practice, and related research.
NUR SCI 118A.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 114A and NUR SCI 112LA and NUR SCI 110W
Prerequisite: BIO SCI E109 and BIO SCI D170

NUR SCI 118B.name: Human Health and Disease II
NUR SCI 118B.description: Presents content on pathologic alterations in physiologic processes in cells, tissues, organs, and systems across the life span. Emphasis on critical thinking, application of concepts to clinical practice, and related research.
NUR SCI 118B.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 114B and NUR SCI 112LB and NUR SCI 125 and NUR SCI 135
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 112LA and NUR SCI 114A and NUR SCI 118A and NUR SCI 110W

NUR SCI 120.name: Adult Health Care
NUR SCI 120.description: Restorative, perioperative, supportive care of adults with acute/chronic alterations in oxygenation, regulation, immune response, elimination, metabolism, mobility, cognition, and substance abuse. Concurrent practicum occurs in inpatient medical-surgical units, perioperative units and outpatient clinics utilizing critical thinking and research skills.
NUR SCI 120.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 140
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 112LB and NUR SCI 114B and NUR SCI 118B and NUR SCI 125 and NUR SCI 135

NUR SCI 125.name: Research Methods and Applications in Health Care
NUR SCI 125.description: Foundational concepts of research in health care. Emphasizes critical evaluation and interpretation of research for application in practice.
NUR SCI 125.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 112LB and NUR SCI 114B and NUR SCI 118B and NUR SCI 135
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 110W and NUR SCI 112LA and NUR SCI 114A and NUR SCI 118A. And a basic statistics course.

NUR SCI 130.name: Maternity and Women’s Health Care
NUR SCI 130.description: Provides didactic and clinical experiences in nursing management of women’s wellness across the lifespan, the childbirth process, and newborn care. Incorporates concepts of family-centered care, teamwork and collaboration, patient safety, quality improvement and informatics, utilizing an evidence-based practice approach.
NUR SCI 130.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 132
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 120 and NUR SCI 140 and NUR SCI 116. NUR SCI 120 with a grade of C or better. NUR SCI 140 with a grade of C or better. NUR SCI 116 with a grade of C or better

NUR SCI 132.name: Pediatrics: Care of Children and Families
NUR SCI 132.description: Provides didactic and clinical experiences in nursing management of infants, children, and adolescents with acute, chronic and/or life-threatening conditions. Incorporates concepts of family-centered care, teamwork and collaboration, patient safety, quality improvement and informatics, utilizing an evidence-based practice approach.
NUR SCI 132.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 130
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 120 and NUR SCI 140 and NUR SCI 116. NUR SCI 120 with a grade of C or better. NUR SCI 140 with a grade of C or better. NUR SCI 116 with a grade of C or better

NUR SCI 133.name: Complementary and Integrative Health
NUR SCI 133.description: Complementary and integrative healthcare emphasized a holistic, patient-focused approach to healthcare and wellness. Key research is critically evaluated and applications for improving patient care emphasized. Knowledge and skills are developed through lectures, guest speakers, and discussion.

NUR SCI 135.name: Older Adult Health Care
NUR SCI 135.description: Theories of aging and application of principles of gerontology in health maintenance of older adults. Concepts and principles of rehabilitation and palliative care.
NUR SCI 135.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 112LB and NUR SCI 114B and NUR SCI 118B and NUR SCI 125
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 112LA and NUR SCI 114A and NUR SCI 118A and NUR SCI 110W

NUR SCI 140.name: Human Behavior and Mental Health Care
NUR SCI 140.description: Biopsychosocial and cultural influences on promotion and restoration of mental health in adults and adolescents. Assessment, classification, and care of clients with mental health problems and/or substance abuse. Concurrent practicum in adult/adolescent inpatient psychiatric units and outpatient mental health clinics.
NUR SCI 140.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 120
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 112LB and NUR SCI 114B and NUR SCI 118B and NUR SCI 125 and NUR SCI 135

NUR SCI 150.name: Critical and Specialty Health Care
NUR SCI 150.description: Delivery of patient-centered care for individuals with life-threatening alterations in health status utilizing technology and pharmacology for life support. Concurrent practicum in critical care units emphasizes collaboration, team work, and quality improvement in safe care delivery.
NUR SCI 150.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 160 and NUR SCI 179AW
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 130 and NUR SCI 132. NUR SCI 130 with a grade of C or better. NUR SCI 132 with a grade of C or better

NUR SCI 160.name: Leadership and Management in Health Care
NUR SCI 160.description: Principles, concepts, and theories related to organizations, management, leadership, decision-making, and group process applied to the delivery of health care. The professional nurse using evidenced-based practice, collaboration, and informatics is incorporated in concurrent practicum emphasizing safe patient care delivery.
NUR SCI 160.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 150 and NUR SCI 179AW
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 130 and NUR SCI 132. NUR SCI 130 with a grade of C or better. NUR SCI 132 with a grade of C or better

NUR SCI 170.name: Community-Based Health Care
NUR SCI 170.description: Epidemiology, primary health care promotion, and disease prevention applied to nursing care of individuals, families, groups, and communities. Includes sociocultural, political, economic, and environmental influences. Concepts and methods of assessing populations and communities incorporated in concurrent practicum.
NUR SCI 170.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 175L and NUR SCI 179B
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 150 and NUR SCI 160 and NUR SCI 179AW. NUR SCI 150 with a grade of C or better. NUR SCI 160 with a grade of C or better. NUR SCI 179AW with a grade of C or better

NUR SCI 175L.name: Clinical Preceptorship
NUR SCI 175L.description: Independent study course focusing on critical thinking skills for nursing practice in selected clinical areas of interest to the student. The clinical experience focuses on core competencies: patient-centered care, evidence-based practice, quality improvement, safety, and informatics.
NUR SCI 175L.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 170 and NUR SCI 179B
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 150 and NUR SCI 160 and NUR SCI 179AW. NUR SCI 150 with a grade of C or better. NUR SCI 160 with a grade of C or better. NUR SCI 179AW with a grade of C or better

NUR SCI 179AW.name: Scholarly Concentration I
NUR SCI 179AW.description: Focuses on analysis and use of evidence to improve nursing practice. Emphasis is to develop critical analysis skills synthesizing a body of research evidence for clinical issues on a formal, collaborative written paper.
NUR SCI 179AW.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 150 and NUR SCI 160
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 130 and NUR SCI 132

NUR SCI 179B.name: Scholarly Concentration II
NUR SCI 179B.description: Continuation of evidence-based research and application for nursing practice. Emphasis is to develop a collaborative quality improvement project with clinical nurses applying the evidence to improve nursing practice.
NUR SCI 179B.prereqString:
Corequisite: NUR SCI 170 and NUR SCI 175L
Prerequisite: NUR SCI 179AW. NUR SCI 179AW with a grade of C or better

NUR SCI 199.name: Independent Study in Nursing Science
NUR SCI 199.description: Original research with Nursing Science faculty.

NUR SCI 200.name: Research Methods and Evaluation for Evidence-Based Practice
NUR SCI 200.description: Clinical research methods and evaluation procedures relevant to evidence-based advanced nursing practice.

NUR SCI 210.name: Advanced Pathophysiology
NUR SCI 210.description: Principles of normal body functioning and pathophysiologic changes that occur as a result of compensatory mechanisms and disease. Physical and psychological aspects of altered health are explored from the cellular to the level of the total body system.

NUR SCI 211.name: Ph.D. Seminar: Nursing and Interdisciplinary Research to Improve Human Health
NUR SCI 211.description: Students learn from interdisciplinary scientists about aspects of applied health-related research. Students are introduced to new paradigms, theories, approaches, and analytical methods in health-related research. Ph.D. Nursing Science students and Ph.D. students in other disciplines are encouraged.

NUR SCI 212.name: Philosophy of Science for Nursing Scholarship
NUR SCI 212.description: Development of philosophy of science in relation to nursing science, scholarship, and practice

NUR SCI 213.name: Measurement of Health-Related Behavior
NUR SCI 213.description: Provides a comprehensive understanding of psychometric principles, analyses, and emerging concepts like Intensive Longitudinal Methods to measure behavior in natural contexts using newer technologies (e.g., smartphones, wearable sensors, and Internet of Things). Students from different disciplines are encouraged.
NUR SCI 213.prereqString: Prerequisite: Recommended: a graduate-level statistics course.

NUR SCI 215.name: Health Promotion/Disease Prevention
NUR SCI 215.description: Covers the evidence-based national clinical preventive services guidelines for health promotion and disease prevention. Emphasizes counseling about personal health behaviors, screening tests for the early dtection of risk factors and disease, immunizations and chemo-prophylaxis.

NUR SCI 216.name: Critical Thinking Through Writing Critique
NUR SCI 216.description: Aims to stimulate critical thinking by using existing scientific literature to work out the structure of their arguments, evaluate their logical clarity, identify unquestioned assumptions, and link all this to the rigor/appropriateness of any inferences made.
NUR SCI 216.restriction: Restriction: Doctor of Philosophy Degree students only. Graduate students only.

NUR SCI 220.name: The Ecology of Healthy Communities
NUR SCI 220.description: Nursing science research contributions and opportunities as they pertain to the ecology of health in local, national, and global communities. Emphasis on methodological and ethical issues, research gaps, and clinical translational opportunities.

NUR SCI 222A.name: Seminar in Clinical Translational Science
NUR SCI 222A.description: Discussion of clinical translational science methods in the context of nursing science research. Emphasis placed on interdisciplinary and community participatory research approaches.
NUR SCI 222A.prereqString: Prerequisite: Consent of the instructor is required.

NUR SCI 222B.name: Seminar in Clinical Translational Science
NUR SCI 222B.description: Discussion of clinical translational science methods in the context of nursing science research. Emphasis placed on interdisciplinary and community participatory research approaches.  Course may be offered online.

NUR SCI 223A.name: Biostatistics for Health Sciences I
NUR SCI 223A.description: Helps students to develop skills necessary for applying statistical principles and practices in health research. This is achieved through in-depth review of existing research articles and hands-on statistical programming exercises.

NUR SCI 223B.name: Biostatistics for Health Sciences II
NUR SCI 223B.description: Introduces advanced methods of statistical analysis and research design used in health research. These include linear, logistic, Poisson regression, and a brief introduction to regression models for correlated data.

NUR SCI 224.name: Research Designs in Nursing Science
NUR SCI 224.description: Provides an introduction to qualitative and quantitative research designs, methods, and analyses in nursing science. Evaluation of measurement and population issues, data management, ethics, analytical approaches, mixed methods work, and translational potential in the context of research.
NUR SCI 224.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Nursing Science Majors only.

NUR SCI 225A.name: Advanced Pharmacology I
NUR SCI 225A.description: Principles of pharmacology that serve as a foundation for the pharmacotherapeutic management of patients evaluated and treated by advanced practice nurses.  Emphasis includes the application of pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic principles.

NUR SCI 225B.name: Advanced Pharmacology II
NUR SCI 225B.description: Principles of pharmacology that serve as a foundation for the pharmacotherapeutic management of patients evaluated and treated by advanced practice nurses.  Emphasis includes the application of pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic principles.
NUR SCI 225B.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 225A. NUR SCI 225A with a grade of B or better

NUR SCI 226.name: Theoretical and Conceptual Frameworks
NUR SCI 226.description: Explores the history, roles, and uses of theory in nursing and health scholarship. Students examine, analyze, and utilize the components of theory, theory construction, concept analysis, and theory evaluation.

NUR SCI 227A.name: Grant Writing I
NUR SCI 227A.description: Introduction to the principles and methods of proposal writing used in preparing grant proposals. Provides content on the process for good proposal development, key elements and sections of proposal, necessary information to include in grant proposal and development of budget.
NUR SCI 227A.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 212 and NUR SCI 226

NUR SCI 227B.name: Grant Writing II
NUR SCI 227B.description: Provides a continuation of skill building in preparing a grant proposal, with emphasis on developing the educational training plan, budget and budget justification, the IRB and ethics component, and letters of support for a career-development grant.
NUR SCI 227B.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 227A. NUR SCI 227A with a grade of B or better

NUR SCI 230.name: Advanced Health and Physical Assessment
NUR SCI 230.description: Application of theoretical concepts related to comprehensive health assessment of patients across the lifespan. Analysis, synthesis, and application of comprehensive health assessment data.

NUR SCI 230L.name: Advanced Health and Physical Assessment Laboratory
NUR SCI 230L.description: Clinical laboratory course for the application of concepts related to comprehensive health assessment of patients across the lifespan.

NUR SCI 231.name: DNP Prologue
NUR SCI 231.description: An onsite 2 ½ day immersive experience that provides an introduction to DNP scholarship and foundations essential for academic success in a doctoral program. Preparatory activities and onsite individual and group assignments are completed.

NUR SCI 232.name: Leadership and Professional Collaboration in Healthcare
NUR SCI 232.description: Explore and debate the relationship between various leadership and collaboration models, theories health care practice, and outcomes. Prepares DNP graduates to assume leadership roles across the healthcare spectrum.

NUR SCI 233.name: Appraisal and Translation of Evidence for Practice
NUR SCI 233.description: Provides advanced concepts on research methods and measurement strategies that are applicable to support the advanced practice nurse to access, evaluate, and utilize data from various sources including research, quality improvement initiatives, and information technology origins to achieve improvements.
NUR SCI 233.prereqString: Prerequisite: Consent of the instructor is required.

NUR SCI 234.name: Health Politics and Policy
NUR SCI 234.description: Participants analyze, apply, and evaluate current health policy-related literature, engage in the process of health policy development within professional, regulatory, or administrative environments, and develop an evidence-based health policy proposal across the spectrum of health care systems.

NUR SCI 235.name: DNP Scholarly Project I: Conceptualization and Planning
NUR SCI 235.description: Students gain the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to develop an evidence-based project plan and proposal. Structured didactic content and application of the Student's DNP Scholarly Project. First of four DNP Scholarly Project courses.

NUR SCI 236.name: Social Determinants of Health and Health Equity
NUR SCI 236.description: The four components of the Clinical Prevention and Population Health Framework: evidence-based practice, clinical preventive service and health promotion, health systems and policy, and population health and community aspects of practice with emphasis on ethical care delivery.

NUR SCI 237.name: DNP Intersession
NUR SCI 237.description: Provides DNP students an opportunity to present and receive faculty and peer feedback on their DNP project plan. Recommendations related to practical data collection and information gathering approaches and data analysis are also emphasized.
NUR SCI 237.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 235. NUR SCI 235 with a grade of B or better

NUR SCI 238.name: Foundations of Health Systems and Health Economics
NUR SCI 238.description: Foundational understanding of how healthcare is financed in the U.S. Explores economic theories and policies, various types of healthcare organizations, and healthcare delivery systems. Healthcare finance is discussed at national and practice levels.

NUR SCI 239.name: The Science of Change, Quality Improvement, and Program Evaluation
NUR SCI 239.description: Intro to science of quality improvement and program evaluation. Focus on info system technology and its application in quality improvement. Focus placed on the role of the advanced practice nurse leader in developing and leading clinical quality and safety initiatives.

NUR SCI 240.name: DNP Scholarly Project II: Proposal
NUR SCI 240.description: Developing a full proposal that reflects synthesis of the student's knowledge from prior coursework and work in an area of interest or expertise under the direction of a faculty mentor. Second of four DNP Scholarly Project course sequence.
NUR SCI 240.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 237. NUR SCI 237 with a grade of B or better

NUR SCI 241.name: DNP Scholarly Project III: Implementation and Evaluation
NUR SCI 241.description: Continued development of knowledge, skills, and abilities to implement the chosen DNP proposal. Students receive direction from a faculty mentor and peer feedback as they become engaged in the microsystem where they are implementing their DNP Scholarly Project.
NUR SCI 241.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 240. NUR SCI 240 with a grade of B or better

NUR SCI 242.name: DNP Scholarly Project IV: Implications
NUR SCI 242.description: Selection and implementation of evidence-based interventions supported through informatics and technological advances and measurement of outcomes in a selected practicum site as applicable. Includes reflection and mapping of the DNP Scholarly Project with DNP Essentials as published.
NUR SCI 242.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 241. NUR SCI 241 with a grade of B or better

NUR SCI 243.name: DNP Epilogue
NUR SCI 243.description: DNP students develop DNP competency through the presentation of their project and development of a professional manuscript. Individual direction from the DNP Project Team and peer feedback are provided throughout the course.
NUR SCI 243.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 242. NUR SCI 242 with a grade of B or better

NUR SCI 245.name: Primary Care Adult/Gerontology Acute Common Conditions
NUR SCI 245.description: Assessment and management of acute or episodic problems affecting patients and families across the lifespan. Diagnostics, pharmacology, pathophysiology, and therapeutics are integrated. Concepts of quality health care, resource management, and shared-decision making are emphasized.
NUR SCI 245.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 210 and NUR SCI 230. NUR SCI 210 with a grade of B or better. NUR SCI 230 with a grade of B or better

NUR SCI 246.name: Qualitative Research Designs in Nursing Science
NUR SCI 246.description: Seminar in qualitative research philosophies, methods, and analysis in nursing science clinical research. Consideration of population access and sampling, ethics, data management, analytical approaches, and translational potential.

NUR SCI 247.name: Quantitative Research Designs in Nursing Science
NUR SCI 247.description: Seminar in experimental and survey research designs, methods, and analysis in nursing science clinical research. Consideration of measurement issues, mixed methods models, population access and sampling, data management, analytical approaches, and translational potential.

NUR SCI 248.name: Curricular Design for the Health Professions
NUR SCI 248.description: Introduces students to the theoretical foundations, essential components, and accreditation standards for curriculum development at the program level. Outcome competencies are addressed as they apply to the development and evaluation of an educational program to meet society’s diverse healthcare needs.

NUR SCI 249.name: Transformational Leadership in Education for the Health Professions
NUR SCI 249.description: Students are introduced to the role of the nurse educator as change agent, leader, and scholar and are provided experience in planning learner-centered learning activities that are engaging and effective in achieving desired student performance.

NUR SCI 250.name: Primary Care Women's Health
NUR SCI 250.description: Primary health care needs of women including adolescent, adult, and aging adults.  Emphasizes assessment, diagnosis, prevention, management, and education of common gynecologic and family planning health care needs.
NUR SCI 250.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 210 and NUR SCI 230. NUR SCI 210 with a grade of B or better. NUR SCI 230 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 250.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 251.name: Nursing Informatics
NUR SCI 251.description: Provides an overview of nursing informatics topics for practice.

NUR SCI 255.name: Primary Care Obstetrics
NUR SCI 255.description: Assessment and management of women during pregnancy. Diagnostics, pharmacology, pathophysiology and therapeutics are integrated. Includes assessment, differential diagnosis, management, patient/family education, and counseling related to normal pregnancy care.
NUR SCI 255.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 210 NUR SCI 230. NUR SCI 210 with a grade of B or better. NUR SCI 230 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 255.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 260A.name: Primary Care Adult/Gerontology Chronic Conditions
NUR SCI 260A.description: Assessment and management of acute or episodic problems affecting adult and geriatric patients and their families. Diagnostics, pharmacology, pathophysiology, and therapeutic are integrated.
NUR SCI 260A.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 245. NUR SCI 245 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 260A.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 262.name: Foundations of Professional Nursing Practice
NUR SCI 262.description: Focuses on the development of skills in therapeutic communication, interviewing, functional assessment across the lifespan, the art and science of human care, and clinical judgment. Faculty-facilitated, participatory peer group, and self-learning laboratory activities are included.
NUR SCI 262.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 263.name: Frameworks for Professional Nursing Practice
NUR SCI 263.description: A theory-intensive course focused on conceptual frameworks for professional nursing practice. Topics address the professional, political, and economic contexts of nursing practice, with an emphasis on jurisprudence and ethics, professional interpersonal relationships, and nursing’s role in the care delivery system.

NUR SCI 264A.name: Applied Pharmacology I
NUR SCI 264A.description: Principles of pharmacology applied to intervention in pathophysiologic states across the life span. Discussion of the major drug groups with implications for monitoring, drug administration, toxicity, and patient education included. Physical, psychological, social, and cultural factors affecting drug administration.
NUR SCI 264A.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 264B.name: Applied Pharmacology II
NUR SCI 264B.description: Principles of pharmacology applied to intervention in pathophysiologic states across the life span. Discussion of the major drug groups with implications for monitoring, drug administration, toxicity, and patient education included. Physical, psychological, social, and cultural factors affecting drug administration.
NUR SCI 264B.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 265.name: Older Adult Health Care
NUR SCI 265.description: Analyzes the interaction of physical, pathophysiological, psychological, social, cultural, and health care policy factors influencing the health and health care of older adults. Topics include health risk factors, health assessment, acute illness and chronic conditions, and ethical issues.
NUR SCI 265.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 266.name: Adult Health Care
NUR SCI 266.description: Focuses on the restorative, peri-operative, and supportive nursing management of adults with acute or chronic alterations in oxygenation, regulation, immune response, elimination, metabolism, mobility, cognition, and substance abuse. Diagnostics, pharmacology, pathophysiology, and therapeutics will be integrated.
NUR SCI 266.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 200 and NUR SCI 262 and NUR SCI 264A and NUR SCI 264B and NUR SCI 268A and NUR SCI 268B and NUR SCI 265 and NUR SCI 281
NUR SCI 266.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 267.name: Human Behavior and Mental Health Nursing
NUR SCI 267.description: Focuses on nursing management of individuals across the lifespan with alterations in mental health. Mental health promotion and crisis intervention, chemical dependency, acute and chronic care for psychiatric conditions, rehabilitation, and recovery will be addressed.
NUR SCI 267.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 200 and NUR SCI 262 and NUR SCI 264A and NUR SCI 264B and NUR SCI 268A and NUR SCI 268B and NUR SCI 265 and NUR SCI 281
NUR SCI 267.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 268A.name: Pathophysiology I
NUR SCI 268A.description: Focuses on pathologic alterations in physiologic processes in cells, tissues, organs, and systems across the life span. Content includes disease processes, linkage of relevant physiology to disease states, and factors that influence epidemiology and pathophysiology.
NUR SCI 268A.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 268B.name: Pathophysiology II
NUR SCI 268B.description: Focuses on pathologic alterations in physiologic processes in cells, tissues, organs, and systems across the life span. Content includes disease processes, linkage of relevant physiology to disease states, and factors that influence epidemiology and pathophysiology.
NUR SCI 268B.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 270.name: Primary Care Pediatrics
NUR SCI 270.description: Assessment and management of acute or episodic problems affecting pediatric patients and their families. Diagnostics, pharmacology, pathophysiology, and therapeutics are integrated.
NUR SCI 270.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 210 and NUR SCI 230. NUR SCI 210 with a grade of B or better. NUR SCI 230 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 270.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 271.name: Community-Based Health Care
NUR SCI 271.description: Epidemiology, primary health care promotion, and disease prevention applied to nursing care of individuals, families, groups, and communities. Includes sociocultural, political, economic, and environmental influences. Concepts and methods of assessing populations and communities incorporated in concurrent practicum.
NUR SCI 271.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 215 and NUR SCI 274 and NUR SCI 276
NUR SCI 271.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 272.name: Pediatrics: Care of Children and Families
NUR SCI 272.description: Provides didactic and clinical experiences in nursing management of infants, children, and adolescents with acute, chronic, and/or life-threatening conditions. Incorporates concepts of family-centered care, teamwork and collaboration, patient safety, quality improvement and informatics, utilizing an evidence-based practice approach.
NUR SCI 272.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 266 and NUR SCI 267
NUR SCI 272.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 273.name: Maternity and Women’s Health Care
NUR SCI 273.description: Provides didactic and clinical experiences in nursing management of women’s wellness across the lifespan, the childbirth process, and newborn care. Incorporates concepts of family-centered care, teamwork and collaboration, patient safety, quality improvement and informatics, utilizing an evidence-based practice approach.
NUR SCI 273.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 266 and NUR SCI 267
NUR SCI 273.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 274.name: Critical and Specialty Health Care
NUR SCI 274.description: Focuses on the restorative, supportive care of individuals with life-threatening alterations in health status utilizing technology and pharmacology for life support. The course includes pathophysiology, diagnostics, monitoring, pharmacology, therapeutics, and evidence-based management interventions will be integrated.
NUR SCI 274.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 272 and NUR SCI 273
NUR SCI 274.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 275.name: Clinical Preceptorship
NUR SCI 275.description: Independent study course focusing on in-depth clinical nursing practice in a selected clinical area of interest to the graduate student. Students are mentored by a preceptor who is an expert clinician in the area.
NUR SCI 275.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 215 and NUR SCI 274 and NUR SCI 276
NUR SCI 275.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 276.name: Leadership and Management in Health Care
NUR SCI 276.description: Explores the professional nurse as leader and manager of a health care team. Principles and theories related to organizations, leadership, decision-making, and group process are applied to the delivery of health care at the individual and population levels.
NUR SCI 276.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 272 and NUR SCI 273
NUR SCI 276.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 279A.name: Frameworks for the Advanced Practice Registered Nursing Role: Nurse Practitioner
NUR SCI 279A.description: Orientation to the scope and standards of advanced practice registered nursing pertinent to the APRN role. Principles of jurisprudence, ethics, and advocacy will be introduced along with conceptual frameworks for advanced nursing practice.

NUR SCI 281.name: Professional Issues in Nursing
NUR SCI 281.description: Provides an orientation to the scope and standards of professional nursing practice for master's students. The social, political, and economic environments affecting health care delivery systems and the ethics of professional nursing practice are analyzed.
NUR SCI 281.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 282.name: Compassionate Care with Underserved Populations
NUR SCI 282.description: Addresses theory/research on health risk factors (e.g., psychiatric illness, sociocultural and economic characteristics) that impact patient health and well-being across the lifespan. Emphasis is on cultural awareness, lifestyle modification, community resources, and communication/coping strategies to promote well-being.

NUR SCI 283.name: Primary Care Procedures
NUR SCI 283.description: Introduces the theoretical basis for common procedures performed in primary care clinical practice. Focus includes EKG interpretation, x-ray interpretation, minor surgery, and orthopaedic procedures.
NUR SCI 283.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 245. NUR SCI 245 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 283.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 284.name: Scholarly Concentration
NUR SCI 284.description: Independent study focusing on critique, analysis, and synthesis of research evidence as a basis for graduate practice nursing in an area of interest to the student.
NUR SCI 284.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 285.name: DNP APRN Practicum I
NUR SCI 285.description: Clinical application of theory and research related to the advanced assessment and health promotion of patients across the lifespan.
NUR SCI 285.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 210 and NUR SCI 230 and (NUR SCI 230L or NUR SCI 231L). NUR SCI 210 with a grade of B or better. NUR SCI 230 with a grade of B or better. NUR SCI 230L with a grade of B or better. NUR SCI 231L with a grade of B or better

NUR SCI 286.name: DNP APRN Practicum II
NUR SCI 286.description: Clinical field study applying theory, research, and developing clinical skills related to the provision of care to patients and their families in increasingly complex clinical situations.
NUR SCI 286.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 285. NUR SCI 285 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 286.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 287.name: DNP APRN Practicum III
NUR SCI 287.description: Clinical application of theory and research through clinical experiences in selected primary care settings designed to provide students with competencies in the assessment, diagnosis, management, and education/counseling in selected populations.
NUR SCI 287.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 286. NUR SCI 286 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 287.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 288.name: DNP APRN Practicum IV
NUR SCI 288.description: Continued clinical application of theory and research through clinical experiences in selected primary care settings designed to provide students with competencies in the assessment, diagnosis, management, and education/counseling in selected populations.
NUR SCI 288.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 287. NUR SCI 287 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 288.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 289.name: DNP APRN Practicum V
NUR SCI 289.description: Culminating clinical experience serves as a transition from the student role to that of the advanced practice nurse.
NUR SCI 289.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 288. NUR SCI 288 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 289.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 290.name: DNP APRN Practicum VI
NUR SCI 290.description: Through continued clinical experience, students demonstrate increased responsibility and accountability for performance as an advanced practice nurse and clinical scholar, synthesizing knowledge of pathophysiology and disease management, evidence-based guidelines, anticipatory guidance, models of provider-patient communication, and provision of educational resources.
NUR SCI 290.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 289. NUR SCI 289 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 290.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 291.name: DNP Practicum I
NUR SCI 291.description: Implementation and evaluation of an evidence-based, DNP project in an area of advanced practice in partnership with a selected agency or organization that solves a practice problem or improves population health, educational, or performance outcomes.

NUR SCI 292.name: DNP Practicum II
NUR SCI 292.description: Implementation and evaluation of an evidence-based, DNP project in an area of advanced practice in partnership with a selected agency or organization that solves a practice problem or improves population health, educational, or performance outcomes.
NUR SCI 292.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 291. NUR SCI 291 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 292.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 293.name: DNP Practicum III
NUR SCI 293.description: Implementation and evaluation of an evidence-based, DNP project in an area of advanced practice in partnership with a selected agency or organization that solves a practice problem or improves population health, educational, or performance outcomes.
NUR SCI 293.prereqString: Prerequisite: NUR SCI 292. NUR SCI 292 with a grade of B or better
NUR SCI 293.restriction: Restriction: Graduate students only. Consent of instructor required to enroll.

NUR SCI 294.name: Directed Study in Vulnerable Populations
NUR SCI 294.description: Independent study that focuses on individually designed clinical learning experiences and goals within a selected vulnerable population, such as the homeless, veterans, minority groups, etc. Students work in a clinical setting addressing health care needs of the vulnerable population(s).
NUR SCI 294.restriction: Restriction: Nursing Science, Community and Population Health Nursing Majors only.

NUR SCI 296.name: Doctoral Dissertation Reading and Writing
NUR SCI 296.description: Dissertation research with Nursing Sciences faculty.

NUR SCI 298.name: Directed Studies in Nursing Science
NUR SCI 298.description: Directed study with Nursing Science faculty.

NUR SCI 299.name: Independent Study in Nursing Science
NUR SCI 299.description: Independent research with Nursing Science faculty.

PATH 200A.name: Research in Experimental Pathology
PATH 200A.description: Independent research for the Ph.D. program within the laboratories of graduate training faculty in Experimental Pathology.

PATH 200B.name: Research in Experimental Pathology
PATH 200B.description: Independent research for the Ph.D. program within the laboratories of graduate training faculty in Experimental Pathology.

PATH 200C.name: Research in Experimental Pathology
PATH 200C.description: Independent research for the Ph.D. program within the laboratories of graduate training faculty in Experimental Pathology.

PATH 200R.name: Research in Experimental Pathology for First-Year Students
