Rigorous instruction in composition and style, including organization, paragraph development, sentence-level mechanics. Letter Grade with P/NP Option.
WRITING 39A.prereqString: Prerequisite: Placement via the UC Analytical Writing Placement Examination is required.

WRITING 39AP.name: Introduction to Writing and Rhetoric with Lab
WRITING 39AP.description: Introduces the principles of rhetoric through readings and writing assignments across a range of genres. Rigorous instruction in composition and style. Designed for students seeking additional English language support. Letter Grade with P/NP Option.
WRITING 39AP.prereqString: Prerequisite: Students must have taken the UC Analytical Writing Placement Examination and the Academic English Placement Test.

WRITING 39B.name: Critical Reading and Rhetoric
WRITING 39B.description: Critical reading and analysis conducted through literary, academic, journalistic, and fictional genres. Students analyze and apply rhetorical principles in a range of writing assignments. Letter Grade with P/NP Option.
WRITING 39B.prereqString: Prerequisite: Satisfaction of the UC Entry Level Writing requirement.

WRITING 39C.name: Argument and Research
WRITING 39C.description: Intensive instruction in research methods, argumentation, and rhetorical invention. Readings selected from current nonfiction and materials located by students from the University library’s holdings, to include databases across a range of disciplines. Letter Grade with P/NP Option.
WRITING 39C.prereqString: Prerequisite: WRITING 37 or WRITING 39B or AP36 or AP37. WRITING 37 with a grade of C or better. WRITING 39B with a grade of C or better. AP36 with a minimum score of 4. AP37 with a minimum score of 4

WRITING 90.name: Intermediate Poetry Writing
WRITING 90.description: Intermediate workshop in the writing of poetry, evaluation of student manuscripts, and parallel readings.

WRITING 91.name: Intermediate Fiction Writing
WRITING 91.description: Intermediate workshop in the writing of fiction, evaluation of student manuscripts, and parallel readings.

WRITING 101W.name: Undergraduate Seminar: Applications in Literary Theory and Criticism for Creative Writing
WRITING 101W.description: Readings in literature, with discussions and written rhetorical responses on their making.
WRITING 101W.prereqString: Prerequisite: (WRITING 30 or WRITING 31) and (WRITING 90 or WRITING 91) and (WRITING 30 or WRITING 31 or WRITING 90 or WRITING 91 or ENGLISH 16 or ENGLISH 17). Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.

WRITING 113.name: Novel Writing
WRITING 113.description: Three-hour advanced workshop in fiction writing

WRITING 139W.name: Advanced Expository Writing
WRITING 139W.description: Study of rhetoric, disciplinary genres, and modes of knowledge production
WRITING 139W.prereqString: Prerequisite: Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.

WRITING 197.name: Writing Internship
WRITING 197.description: Internships focused on writing. In consultation with a faculty advisor, students create a course from response essays, research essays, and assessment project data. Internships may include editing and publication projects, supervised teaching and tutoring assignments, community literacy projects.
WRITING 197.prereqString: Prerequisite: Satisfactory completion of the lower-division writing requirement.

WRITING 250A.name: Graduate Writers' Workshop (Fiction)
WRITING 250A.description: Graduate fiction workshop open to students enrolled in the MFA program in Writing.

WRITING 250B.name: Graduate Writers' Workshop (Fiction)
WRITING 250B.description: Graduate fiction workshop open to students enrolled in the MFA program in Writing.

WRITING 250C.name: Graduate Writers' Workshop (Poetry)
WRITING 250C.description: Graduate poetry workshop open to students enrolled in the M.F.A. Programs in Writing.

WRITING 251A.name: Writing in Conference (Fiction)
WRITING 251A.description: Graduate fiction workshop open to students enrolled in the MFA program in Writing.

WRITING 251B.name: Writing in Conference (Fiction)
WRITING 251B.description: Graduate fiction workshop open to students enrolled in the MFA program in Writing.

WRITING 251C.name: Writing in Conference (Poetry)
WRITING 251C.description: Graduate poetry workshop open to students enrolled in the M.F.A. Programs in Writing.
